reviewTitle: First time spending money on a gaming keyboard.
reviewDescription: I always just used my K120 Logitech Keyboard, its 10 bucks, I can use up to like 5 keys at once and never had trouble with how many keys Im allowed, its quiet when typing, the keys are easy to press and find, and it did the job well.However, after 5 years of use, it broke. (Finally, I know right?) and I decided to spend a whole 7 dollars more on a keyboard.Then I bought this, its terrible, the buttons are clickey, the cord is flimsey, the lights are so shiny it hurts my eyes.Just kidding.The buttons are amazing, what become easy to click, became easier, everything feels so smooth, the keys are fairly quiet but its probably just because I am a light typer. The lights allow me to turn my lights off and not have to guess where my keys are when I type. I found my WPM went up by 10 words per minute, originally it was 60, now its 70. Much easier to type because of the smooth and easy transition for my fingers and how open, easy, and strong the buttons are. Each button feels distinct and easy to find for my muscle memory.The buttons are tough as nails, I can easily tell this keyboard will last a while, its easy to clean under them due to how the keyboard was made, literally can just blow the gunk off with a can of ultra duster.As for the gaming part, every single key I press reacts, I can press as many damned keys as I want and they all work perfectly. The best part is how the F1 - F4 is set up, each F keys are lined in 4, this means in games that require me to use F1 - F4 are much easier to play because of how the intelligent designers set this up. For instance, in SC2 I need to press the F keys to set up my camera hotkey so its easier to move from location to location, I am CONSTANTLY pressing these keys as Zerg and before I always tended to hit ESC or F5 but because of how these keys are set up, I never make those mistakes again. And due to the distinction of the F keys, I never accidently hit the wrong F key anymore either. Dramatically improving my capability to play.Whats more, sometimes even with my K120, I have to press more than 5 keys and that 6th key wont go through. This means if I have to run and turn, which is A, D, Shift, and then jump, space, and then press Capslock to talk, and then ult which is `, my ult wont go off because thats 6 keys. In Overwatch this is incredibly common. You need to constantly run, jump, talk, and sometimes ult at the same time. Many times I make this mistake, I will wind up dying or causing someone else to die. However, no longer does this happen with this keyboard!The LED keys are great, not too bright. I wish I could have a only blue option but I dont mind.I only have one negative thing to say: The space sucks balls, its loud, and... well its just loud. I am a very quiet typer because of how my fingers have to move quickly accross the keyboard and every time I have to press space I cringe a little. I found out why its like this, the springs arent tightened, whoever made this keyboard made the springs on it very loose however thats also another great thing about this keyboard: You can fix it because you can see the springs, which means with a knife or tweezers, you can easily push the springs apart a bit to tighten up the spacebar. I just havent gotten around to it.This keyboard is a work of art, for the price, I'd say its 100 percent worth it. I'd say this is worth 60 bucks in my opinion but I'll go with 19, I aint complainin.

Great and solid keyboard, fun times. Logitech and Razer must recognize the NPET! This keyboard is thin, not bulky, and has a solid METAL baseplate. It feels sturdy and heavy, doesn't slide around on my desktop. There are dual springs on the space bar and the keyboard includes a red key puller tool. The keystrokes are deep, precise and quiet. My typing/keystroke accuracy is much improved on this keyboard. No drivers were needed, and you can adjust the colors and effects just how you like them using the Function key on the keyboard. There is a Windows key lockout.  The keyboard backlight turns off after a few idle minutes, and I am not sure if the time-out can be adjusted. The media keys work. Very solid keyboard for the price.

Was looking for a cheap and easy setup for a secondary PC that children would be using for general web browsing, homework, and occasional gaming.  This combo fit the bill and then some.  The feel of the keyboard is smooth and responsive with functional feedback and resistance in the keys.  The only downside is the audible noise you get from keystrokes.The Mouse is pleasantly smooth with good button engagement and response.  The DPI switch is a very nice addition and performs flawlessly when needed.The winning tick for this combo is the RGB quality at this price point.  The keyboard provides an impressive array of colors that are not overly bright or distracting, but not so muted that they regress out of sight.  The Mouse has a nice fading array of simplistic lines that adds to the ambiance of the lighting package.Overall, I think it's a great package for light general use.  The RGB features really add to the value and provide an impressive overall package for the price.

Pro:Nice feel.  The stroke is a bit long compared to my last keyboard but the feel is excellent.  Just while writing this review I have gotten used to the longer stroke.Heavy back plate.  This puppy is not sliding around without me intending to move it.I am not sure if a mechanical keyboard but it sure feels like it.Very inexpensive for a mechanical keyboard.This will probably be the easiest keyboard to clean since when you used to unplug them and take them into the shower with you a 2 or 3 decades ago.  There is no tray the keys are sitting in to hold dust, bits of potato chip, cat hair (my cats like laying on keyboards for some reason), ...  I do not see even a reason to remove the keycaps except to put on different ones for different languages.Con:Tabs for raising angle of the keyboard, like so many including expensive keyboards are cheap fragile plastic and will probably break within a few months.No macro keys, programmable or otherwise.  To be honest this might be unfair.  A great many keyboards have abandoned using macro keys but they really help with a lot of programs including productivity software but gaming especially.  I think programming them gives people fits.  Oh well.  Also this is a very inexpensive keyboard with a mechanical keyboard feel.Other:The lighting schemes are nice but I would personally prefer just a straight white lighting behind the keys.  I am retired.  I am a vampire as to my sleep wake cycle.  I am up usually all night long and up only in the daytime if there is something I have to do.  I however do not wish to waste electricity so I tend to keep the lights off.  This means I cannot see my keyboard and with my aging eyes, I really want as much contrast to make it easy to read what the keys are at night.I am considering purchasing another couple for backups for when this eventually (hopefully far in the future) fails.
Keys are a bit blocky, but best for the price. Works great, color is great.

reviewTitle: Color lit keyboard at affordable price
reviewDescription: Small enough to fit on a desk.The keys are distinct and easy to use for accurate typing.Love the colors!

Pros: The light effects are pretty cool. Keys work properly. All keys are present and in a reasonably correct place. Can set only one stationary color or transition to different colors. Cons: Lights key great when on, but if left untouched the go off, which makes it hard to see first letter to type. Maybe there is a function to turn off power saving mode?

For the price I honestly expected this keyboard/mouse to not be very good. Boy was I shocked when I took it out of the box. The keyboard is very sturdy and well made with metal and plastic parts not solid plastic. I feels good and is quiet. I am so impressed with this product I'm going to buy another set for my office.

Overall I am pleased with this purchase  Initially, I could not control the sound volume.  This was very frustrating.  Then I read the directions that are in microscopic font, barely readable. Once I grabbed the magnifying glass things became legible. HINT- Press the FN key while activating function keys that control the sound system. Sound control is no longer a problem!!

The lights are very vibrant and customizable! Great battery life between charges when I forget to plug it in! Setup was as simple as plugging in the usb to my pc and switching on the devices! Between the price and the product I couldn't recommend it more!
Easy to setup nice not to worry about battires just charge it up when needed.

reviewTitle: LED Key is actually (M2 Home) key on this model.  Love this keyboard
reviewDescription: Love this keyboard Bought one for myself and then purchased 2 more: one for my wife and another one as a spare backup or for the keys in case they wear out. ( can not find replacement keys on-line for this product . However for the price, it made sense to me just to buy a back-up.___________________________________________________________________________________Instructions are a bit sketchy. " What is referred to as LED key is actually the M2 (home ) key " on this model .. Hitting the Fn  key and the M2 key together allows you to see the keyboard lighting colors that are available, )Stopping on the color that you prefer sets that color as a default'

I've had it a few days now and LOVE it!  It's been years sense I last purchased my keyboard and spilled coffee : (  this caused my number keys to stick, yuk.  This new keyboard is made to avoid such accidents from damaging the keys, I can only hope, lol.It's much quieter than the old one, I actually kinda miss that tapping noise as I typed- hubby doesn't!  Great product for the price and the back lite keys are nice.  I'm not a gamer, so I can attest to that, ergonomic was really what was top on my list.  I'm Very Happy!  Highly recommend this keyboard.

Artículo en excelente estado, concuerda con la descripción de la tienda, funciona perfecto y además tiene un buen empaquetamiento que protegió el producto. Se los recomiendo para los que estén interesados.
i am really liking this key board and it is very durable and it will not die.

Bought this to replace a non lit wireless keyboard I had for years. This one works great,  you can leave it plugged in to charge and it still works.  I like that it lights up to see the keys when I'm working at 5am.

I'm not a gamer, but an engineer who has been using PC's since we booted from floppies..  Based on backlit keyboard and price I bought this unit, replacing a basic keyboard that came with the PC.  The difference is amazing.  The tactile feedback, the feel of the contoured keys, makes it a joy to use.  I'm making far fewer fat finger errors.As someone who eats too often at the keyboard the fact that the keyboard is "waterproof" and  the way the keys are mounted and removable makes it much easier to keep the keyboard clean and functional.The documentation that came in the box is minimal, but a quick search found very helpful online sites including a video on the features of the keyboard.It is an amazing keyboard for the price.
I love this keyboard. Bought one for my office and my home office.

I've wasted so much money on expensive keyboards just to accidentally spill a drink on them and ruin them.  As a gamer/streamer, I sometimes get caught up in the moment and lose track of my drink and/or hands and the next thing you know, your keyboard is soaked.  With this keyboard, it's not an issue.  I have actually spilled multiple sticky sugary drinks on it and it keeps pluggin' away. I have not gone so far as to intentionally spill large amounts of liquid or submerge it to test it.  My experience is based on actually accidentally knocking over a drink and spilling a small-ish amount of liquid.The feel of the keyboard is good.  It's much quieter then a mechanical keyboard, but louder then a membrane one. The keys have a nice click with decent finger feedback.  I'm a gamer, but not a professional by any means, so I don't need a super expensive keyboard with Cherry Switches, etc.  This style works great for me.The only downside is that in the time I have had this keyboard, the paint on the S, A and D keys have worn off and the Left Shift, Space Bar, C and W keys are wearing off too.  But the function is still 100%!The RGB is limited to Four modes, 3 different sets of static rainbow colors and off.Overall, a solid keyboard at a great price.  I liked it so much I bought a second one for my second computer.  Highly recommend!

Works well for what I use if for. Was slightly disappointed that it didn't have biome LED effects while playing Terraria, but that's on me for not paying attention to the software specs. But, as a trade off, I'm happy it doesn't ask me to install their specific extra bloat ware program to control the LEDs, that is very nice.

As strictly a keyboard? This product is...fairly good.  Keys have a nice feel to them.  No false key clicks, no excessive pressure required and so on.  Would be nice if the letters were solid and didn't contain spaces in them like they were printed using an old stencil but, hey, so what if my "B" key looks like a palm tree growing out of the ground if viewed sideways? And my "O" key an omega symbol without the loops on the ends?Where this product really fails is with the backlight timeout.  If you don't press a key, it's "lights out" after 7 minutes and 11 seconds.  No way to adjust that or turn it off.  You've got to find...in the dark...because your backlit keyboard isn't lit...and press a key to turn it on again.Oh, and I'll save you the effort of using a search engine for a hack or solution: There isn't one.  Any ones that you find apply strictly to the cordless version.  If you're using the USB version like I am, none of those work.  Which is kind of silly because, seriously, how much power are you going save by turning off the backlight after 7 minutes of keyboard inactivity...pennies?So, if you want a continuously lit keyboard, this isn't the one for you.  If you want keys without strange gaps in the lettering, this isn't the one for you.  Other than that? Go for it.

reviewTitle: Well Loved, but Only Lasted a Year
reviewDescription: Purchased this keyboard a little over a year ago (October 2022), and I truly love it! I am not a gamer, or anything fancy like that. I use the keyboard for my workstation (I WFH).I am a fairly quick typer, and for whatever reason, last week, the keyboard started skipping letters as I was typing. It wasn't the same letter (I checked), and it wasn't consistent. So, I made sure to charge it over the weekend, and sure enough, Monday morning...still skipping random letters as I was typing. Haven't made any changes to the way I was hitting the keys. I am going to say that after 13 months of using it (on average) 6 days a week, for 9 hours (avg) a day, the keyboard is dying on me.I get on Amazon to look at purchasing another keyboard, and sure enough, I am a sucker!I truly love this keyboard (see image of well-loved keys).I appreciate having the backlight (I get migraines, so sometimes my overhead light is off). I am a big fan of the auditory feedback mechanical keyboards give me, and the "clacking" is JUST. RIGHT on this one.I don't have to worry about battery replacements (thank goodness), just charge it once or twice a week at this point, and I am good to go!But how can I make it last longer than a year?? Sigh

reviewTitle: Decent but 0 key sticks on 10 key
reviewDescription: comfortable keyboard and like that it's quite, however on the 10 key area the 0 key sticks sometimes and have to press hard to make it work.
I do like the keyboard & mouse however after 6 months the arrow keys have stopped working. Nothing was spilled on it either.
I really like it and think it works well. Unfortunately the letters are rubbing/ chipping away. I’m pretty good at typing but it gets harder the more keys that are blank.

reviewTitle: Right half LEDs dont work after a few weeks
reviewDescription: Works fine as a keyboard but the LEDs on the right half wont light up anymore, I got this a few weeks ago :(

reviewTitle: Very comfortable and snappy, but the lighting is all wrong.
reviewDescription: Key feel is good, works well, but the one thing couldn't stand was that the light comes up around the bottom of the keys, and the letters on the keys themselves do not light up.  Totally useless to me for what I needed it for as I wanted to be able to see the characters on the keys for use in darkened conditions.  Never even used up the first charge on the batteries before I ordered a different brand that has light up characters.

I bought this based on high customer satisfaction.  However, there are two main items of concern.  One, the keys don’t light up.  There is a backlight, but the keys are not lit so if you’re in a dark room, you can’t see the keys if you need to see them.  Second, and way worse, the Space bar squeaks EVERY time I hit it.  And I type MASSIVE amounts for work and it drives me absolutely crazy.  I try to drown it out with music but it doesn’t help (maybe if I use headphones).  But that Space bar squeaking makes me want to smash this keyboard through the wall.EDIT: I popped off the space bar, brushed off the area, pushed down on the springs a few times, put the space bar back on, and it doesn’t squeak anymore.

reviewTitle: Works well, but the paint on the keys is not great
reviewDescription: Works well, and is nice and bright. But the paint on the letters of the keys is spotty. I suppose you get what you pay for.
I have moved on to mechanical but this works as a beginner keyboard
Loved the color and how easy it was to use. I was worried it wouldn’t work with my husband’s Linux laptop, but it worked wonderfully!

reviewTitle: Perfect Keyboard - Alot of light combinations and control
reviewDescription: Very nice lighterd keyboardChange colors brightness etc.Very nice quality materials

reviewTitle: Great keyboard, highly recommend. only problem is with LEDs
reviewDescription: have been using this keyboard for almost a week now, and im loving this product a lot. me and my friend have been playing a lot of Garry's Mod and messing around on that game, and ive enjoyed using this keyboard for my computer. my only complaint with this keyboard is that, whenever you stop using your keyboard for a while and you have the LEDs on, the LEDs on the keyboard will turn off automatically until you start using it again. however, sometimes the entire keyboard wont shut off, so sometimes a part of the LEDs will just randomly stay on, even when youre not using it. other than that, this is one of the best, if not THE best keyboard i have ever owned

My old keyboard broke down.A lot of modern keyboards are really bad at control keys.  I switched to the keyboard that came with my HP computer, and was pretty dissatisfied with it.  I always use the CTRL key on the left.  My hand can reach ^W, ^E, and ^R, all of which are very important keys in emacs, but the HP keyboard kept not registering the CTRL key so instead of those control characters I was getting 'w', 'e', and 'r' respectively.I bought a Logitech MK120 keyboard on Amazon.  It turned out to be far worse.  I figured it would be good, because the photos look as if, unlike the more modern keyboards, the keys travel a significant distance down.  The keys do travel, but the behavior on difficult CTRL keys was even worse than on the HP keyboard.  Even when I was very consciously pressing down really hard on the CTRL key, sometimes, instead of getting '^W', or 'w' I got weird, illegal characters transmitted which would make emacs hang and I've have to kill the process from another window.40 years ago, before the IBM PC was introduced, most computers had the CTRL key where the CAPS LOCK key is now.  There are these "Happy Hacker" keyboards you can buy like that, but they're hundreds of dollars, and I don't want to get used to a keyboard like that because when I'm using a computer other than the one at my own desk, like when I'm at a co-worker's computer, I won't be accustomed to the layout.This keyboard, which hardly cost anything, REALLY solves the problem.  The keys travel a considerable distance when pushed down, and it NEVER misinterprets CTRL keys.

If your in the market for an inexpensive keyboard and reading this review considering the NPet K10, I'll save you a bunch of time. Just buy it you wont be disappointed!Every once in awhile an incredible offer and value comes along, and this keyboard at $15 is one of those times. It's a bit ridiculous really and hard to believe your getting so much.... for so little, but I couldn't be more happy with this purchase. I just wish that 50% of the items I bought in my life were like this, because if they were I'd be a much happier person.Just so you know I'm coming from a Logitech G413 mechanical keyboard. That being said I know what a mechanical keyboard feels like and how it performs, so I'm not all dazzled by all the pretty lights of this one. What I'm talking about is all of the tech and performance that is on my desk right now with this keyboard, and how smoothly it operates. All things considered compared to the mechanical keyboard I came from, I don't feel that I'm losing anything. All of this for an amazingly low price of only $15.Buy it you wont be sorry or disappointed!

I just replaced the first keyboard with the same model and ordered another for a spare.Even though I clean my hands well my problem. I wear the letters off very fast This keyboard lasted like 3 times longer then any other keyboard.i just need to sit down and find well wearing stick on letters to put it back in service.
It’s a very good keyboard and it came with one of those things you take out key caps with

reviewTitle: Nearly the perfect budget membrane keyboard
reviewDescription: No, the title isn't an exaggeration.Let's go over the cons I've had with it first.The RGB isn't what you'd get out of something that runs for several times higher in cost.The bottom key row, ctrl/win/alt/space/etc are dome shaped as opposed to the rest of the keys that are recessed, so it has an bit of an odd feel on that row.  Would have preferred it universal except for the space bar.That's it.  They're not even issues, one is preference, and one is straight vanity.Pros?  Everything else.NO ODD-SHAPED KEYS!  Typically on budget keyboards not from the big-brands have some odd formatting on their keyboards.  On this, every key is in it's standard spot.The ergonomics are great, it's a minimalist style full keyboard, low footprint.  If you wanted a wrist rest, you might need to look elsewhere.Wireless works great, no issues with connectivity at 10+ ft.  No noticeable issues with latency, but you shouldn't be using a wireless keyboard if that was a big concern anyway.Keys are very responsive, nearly mechanical in feel.  Though I wouldn't compare it to a mechanical, the keys have a nice action for a membrane keyboard.VALUE!  The biggest thing the has to offer NPET K11 offers is the value.  Just a few years ago you wouldn't be able to get a keyboard like this for double the price, and this is coming in at under 30 bucks.I bought this to use on the couch for my HTPC, works perfectly.
I love how the keys feel. Stylish and cool LED lights for night. All the keys are included (hot keys) and number pad.
Jets are great, they don’t stick or squeak. It’s so nice and sturdy but doesn’t take up the whole desk. 10/10 would buy again
Excelente
Keyboard is working like it should so far so good.
I spilt salad dressing on my keyboard and in a rush bought this one because of the price and how fast it would come.  Now everyone is jealous because it is gorgeous!
Nice looking, good quality

reviewTitle: Even great for those who don't do gaming.
reviewDescription: I am a mom, in her mid 50's, and work from home. I am not a gamer by any means, however,  I am on the computer all day for my job, and, it is an extremely stressful job!!!  My son bought this same keyboard for himself because he is an extreme gamer, and when I saw the glowing colors, and then he showed me the color schemes and what the keyboard can do,  I was very intrigued.  I tried the keyboard to see if it can keep up with me, and to see if It was comfortable, and I fell in love.  I've had it for a few weeks now and it is still working great. Seeing the colors on the keyboard sometimes, not always, but at least sometimes keeps me from wanting to stab myself when I am dealing with a customer from hell.  Anyone with a stressful computer job should consider this keyboard. I haven't tried the blinking lights yet, because I think that might be a bit too distracting, but I have been having fun with changing the color theme. This certainly beats the blah, dark, non colorful keyboards I had been using in the past.
Wakes up fast and the keyboard is quality. Nice keys and a metal base. No complaints with my purchase.
I wanted a fun keyboard and the colors perk things up! Not a gamer, just at a desk all day long...

Updated again again in 2022:Still going strong.  Some of the black is wearing off the keyboard, but it's still very legible, and everything is functioning beautifully!!Updated again in 2021:It's still going strong.  Colors are great, it's durable.  The only thing is that a few of my most frequented keys are showing a bit of wear on the paint-- but I haven't had a single problem with this keyboard.  It's definitely my favorite, and for the price?  I've never found better.  Color me surprised.Updated:Replacement keyboard arrived.  I had no problem returning the non-working one.  Replacement works fabulously- no dead keys, no problems.  Despite the first broken one- I am terribly happy with this keyboard. Feels super sturdy.  The lights are wonderful (but not too bright to cause problems seeing what you're doing), the keys have a great response.  It sounds nice.  I like everything about this keyboard and am really surprised at the low price.Previously:  It's gorgeous.  It has a great feel to it.  The lights are great for people who need lighted keys- the colors are pretty.. it even has a nice "not too clacky" sound to it... but mine arrived with several dead keys.  The D, H, W, ', and Enter keys didn't work.  Don't know what else didn't work, as I packed it up and sent it back.That said though, I'm willing to give it one more try.  Aside from the crappy keys, I liked everything about it.  I'll update my review if the second keyboard is faulty as well.

My original review didn't do this key oard justice. This was the first gaming, mechanical, keyboard I ver bought. I originally went for it because of the price and the fact the lights looked cool. I'm glad I bought it. There are only three selections with the lights and it gets boring, but what I paid attention to most was the feel of the keyboard. I originally bought it for my desk at work and sometimes took it home for gaming. It was responsive enough for gaming, but when it came to work this thing increased my typing speed. It's comfortable for my fingers to move nimbly over the keys and with the design I've never had the issue of my fingers pressing two keys at once. The key that I press would be the key I wanted. It helped greatly with wrist pains as well. The old dell keyboard I was using made my hands tired over time, but I could comfortablely use this keyboard for long periods with no issues. The noise to me isn't so bad though my coworkers could tell I was in when by my typing, lol. Over time the black paint comes off but not in a drastic way and it's a sturdy keyboard that doesn't feel cheap. I gave it to my sibling since they were having pain in their hands and even though it's a hand me down my sibling loves it. They said they felt relief. Would recommend to buy and would have zero issue buying another.

I returned a Logitech mx keyboard because the keys were to easy to push down, causing errors.  The real keyboard I wanted after that was a 240 dollar keyboard but I needed something in the meantime, so I just went cheap with this one.  Well...im not getting that 240 dollar one, this one is great and im keeping it.  simple and precise.
This might be one of the best keyboards I ever owned. It's lightweight and it's very responsive and great for a fast typer
I like the keys and how they type.  The keys feel like piano keys.  I don’t make typing errors since the keys are are not flat or close together

After having a much more expensive mechanical keyboard become unusable in under a year, I decided to try this one based on favorable reviews and because the price was low, so low risk.  Turns out I like everything about it, great feel for typing, really nice color schemes, and I like how the backlighting goes out after idling for a while, which is good for watching a movie.  If this holds up for even a year, it will have been a better buy than my last keyboard.

Love this keyboard and love the sound it makes when typing it’s loud and not too clacky, I purchased another brand and literally worked for 2 days and gave out I’m so glad it did because I would’ve never found this one. Fully aware this isn’t the greatest video but it’s as best as I can get!
I was skeptical about the quiet part, but this keyboard is super quiet for what it is. Rbg is good. Feel nice to type on. 10/10 would recommend this keyboard for the price.

reviewTitle: Good keyboard at an amazing price
reviewDescription: I'm just your regular type of guy.  I surf the web,  play some games, and occasionally write a review.  During a moment of game induced rage, I slammed my hand into my old keyboard and snapped the space bar in half.  It still worked, but it wasn't reliable and I could see more rage coming if I wasn't able to use my space bar properly.  That is when my search for a keyboard began.  I found this bad boy for under 20 bucks and thought it would be ok... you know, do the job.  Well, it does.  It even has features I don't care about.  Like LED lights under the keys.  It has 3 different color schemes + 1 more to turn them off.  They are also dimmable with 3 different levels of brightness.  The keys feel nice under my fingers.  They aren't clicky loud like the keyboard my kid uses.  So far i'm happy with my purchase.  For the price, I feel it would be hard to beat it.UPDATE: So, as of November 2022 (so about 3.5 years of use) this keyboard is still going strong.  I have successfully worn off the letters from the S and D keys, with the A and C keys barely still displaying the letter.  The cat knocked the keyboard off my desk and the space bar flew off.  After a bit of trying I was able to get it back on and it works fine again.  I feel like at this price point, this is an absolute bargain gem.Final update: I have now started experiencing some functional issues. The usb plug needs to be held in a certain way when plugged in to work. I have decided to retire this budget winner. I got 3.5 years of heavy use out of this inexpensive keyboard. I'm not mad that it broke, just sad. RIP budget goat.
My children play roblox on there laptops (which are not made for that). A few of the keys became stuck and or broken. Long story short got these plug and play , bright, colors pop great buy...
The lights look amazing and Good for the price.Haven’t used it yet because it’s a Christmas present but I did plug it in to check it out.

We got this a while back and we still have it today! It is very cool. The light still work too. The buttons are kinda weird and like I’m not sure how to even explain it. But I’m pretty sure that’s because my brother would always mess around with it. But it worked perfectly fine before so no worry🐻😜

Not a gamer, I work early mornings from home and now that's it's dark when I start I don't like turning on the house lights so this light up keyboard is great. It's sturdy and the lights do shine through the numbers and letters various led light settings. I fricken love it. You can even set it to all one color. I am gonna have fun with this each month I will change the lights.

I needed to replace a current keyboard and didn't want to pay  alot for a keyboard at the time. Worth it 100% Price was way more than reasonable. I didn't want to leave a premature review. 3 months since I bought it. I am pleased with this product. I would recommend it to friends.

reviewTitle: Works well, not crazy about the lighting colors
reviewDescription: Works well, but I don't really like the colors of the lighting of the keyboard.  Has a pretty good battery life and good response to the keys and mouse.

reviewTitle: Awesome Keyboard For Gaming On The Go!
reviewDescription: I love this keyboard and mouse combo! Super affordable and very portable! The USB to wirelessly connect to the computer is small and different from other wireless setups. I travel for work and can't stand the keyboard on my laptop, so this was a must. The keyboard has a nice click on it and is comfortable to use, it feels anything, but cheap and the mouse is very compact, but not too small! I love gaming and everyday browsing with this setup!
I really like this keyboard.

reviewTitle: Love the keyboard. Some improvements over old charge port  , now c is better.
reviewDescription: I have bought like everyone else at least a dozen wireless keyboards and the charge port always breaks.  This is better with the C style. Hopefully I can make it last.
This gaming keyboard is a great addition to my pc. The illumination is amazing. The keys are easy to push and feel sturdy.

I needed a new keyboard and realized that a backlight would benefit me. Sometimes I turn on my computer in low light and need to see the keys.  I like that the backlighting "times out" after a few minutes when you are not using it, and all it takes is one touch to turn it back on.  This keyboard is higher (thicker) than my old keyboard, so I pulled out my gel keyboard wrist rest and it was perfect.  I recommend the wrist rest with this keyboard.  I was able to understand the instructions for the keyboard, so I can turn adjust the lighting with the correct function.  It uses a USB to plug into my computer and worked right away.  I like the bounce on the keyboard and am pleased with how quiet it is.  It was a good value, too!!

1st, this is a good keyboard for the money, but beware:- I liked my old NPET keyboard better(keys felt less spongy, personal preference).- The clear letters/numbers on the keys that the LED light bleeds through are not high quality and crisp lettering (hard to make out what some symbols are).- The LED color constantly scrolls across the keyboard. You can slow it down, but it still does it.- The LEDs don't just shine through the keys. The light shines up under the keys too. This is distracting. I just want the light to be under the keys so I can make out what the keys are in a dark room and I want to be able to dim the LEDs down to the point where I can still make out the symbols/letters/numbers, but not blind me. Its similar to the effect of turning the light on in your vehicle at night.- The LEDs have a sleep function which could be nice, but you need the ability to turn it off. I have to hit the ctrl button to wake it back up so that I can see the button that I actually need to press.

This is a great keyboard and mouse so far. I will update if I find anything unusual. I do not game but I work 9 hours a day with a keyboard. I wanted to get a mechanical because I like the feel better. If you do not need the back light this keyboard and mouse last all week without charging. If you need the back light then it will last about 20 hours. I have attached a pic of some controls since it does not come with instructions. Happy Typing.
I like this

Sometimes when I press the backspace, I get the forward slash. It's annoying, especially when trying on a crunch. Apart from that, it's a perfect buy. Very durable. More silent that the keyboards I've had previously, which my spouse loves.

Who wouldn’t like all the bright colors moving across and adding color to my workspace! Love that it goes to sleep after no use for a few minutes so I can leave and not have the keyboard just keep going. Has great functionality and the little instructions show you how to change and use the keyboard fully. Worth it and then some! So impressed

This is an awesome keyboard, especially for the money. It has a metal base, so it is solid and doesn't move easily. It has two little supports on the back to angle it towards you, which is nice. Also, I love the light function. It is easy to toggle between the different light functions. This is actually the third keyboard that I got because with the other two, one was too small/compressed and one had a return key on the right that was in a different formation, so I would keep hitting the slash key. All things considered 10/10.

This is a replacement keyboard of the same product. I guess I used the old one so much, the letters rubbed off the frequently used keys. 🤣No complaints! I use it for work. It does what it needs to do!

Over all i really like this keyboard. The colors are nice but are also able to turn off which is good. Keys are quiet but deep like i like them. Only thing i would change is the length of the charging cord. i'd prefer to keep it plugged in at all times so i don't have to worry about it dying on me but its just a tad too short to reach from the back of my computer tower, through my desk to the keyboard. Otherwise, I love the feel & look.

reviewTitle: Good quality and good for gaming!
reviewDescription: I usually dont write reviews but after using this keyboard and looking for an 'upgraded gaming keyboard' I had to come back and write one.  Compared to some Logitec and Razer keyboards this one is a much better choice especially given the price is 1/3.  It was so good I decided to get a 2nd but in the wireless version. The keys havent worn down, sas in there is no noticable fading of the letters and I have used it a LOT for gaming. The AWSD keys have no sign of wear.  Thumbs up for this keyboard!
Bought this for work - nice to use (not too loud and nice feel) and looks great!
Very nice and simple key board and mouse. Really hope it doesn’t break down in a month.

reviewTitle: Excellent Keyboard at a Great Price!
reviewDescription: I have purchased two of these keyboards. I enjoyed the first one so much I purchased one to replace the keyboards I get at the office. The games have a good mechanical feel with tactile and audible feedback, and no annoying noise (springs popping, "clackiness"). The keyboard sits flat, no rocking. And the backlight works well, though I stick with a uniform green you can make it do any color plus motion. I may purchase another just to have a spare or to use with my laptop on the road.
Seems to do the trick
The product is what it says it is. Light's up like the mouse, is colorful and better than my old keyboard. I highly recommend this product.

I love this keyboard! It works well and it stays charged for quite a while. The mouse is a good size and also lasts a while. I like that they light up. The price was great and definitely worth it. It’s very easy to use, just plug and play.
The large buttons are great.  It lights up too.
my boyfriend absolutely loves this keyboard. Its big, comfortable, led, and has so many extra keys and features. 10/10 keyboard it does more than its job.
Good all around keyboard.
THE BOARD IS VERY COMFORTABLE. THE LIGHTED BACKGROUND IS VIVID AND A GREAT PERK!

reviewTitle: Just what I was looking for.
reviewDescription: I really like this keyboard, plenty of backlighting color options, inexpensive, works great, looks cool & NO software installation or updates required, just plug it in and use it. I highly recommend this keyboard.

reviewTitle: KEYS ARE PERFECT TO USE.  I NEED BIGGER KEYS
reviewDescription: THIS IS AN AWESOME KEYBOARD AND PRICE WAS VERY REASONABLE.  EVERYONE LOVES THE COLOR CHANGES.
I bought this for work, it’s been great and easy to use haven’t had any problems, recommend it to my coworker they bought one too!
It’s kinda small but has all the right features and colors just right for gamers. Item is as described by the seller! Would recommend!

reviewTitle: Black is rubbing off the keys
reviewDescription: This was only delivered about a month ago. I haven't cleaned it but the black is rubbing off the most used keys. Pretty colors but pretty soon I won't be able to see the characters.

reviewTitle: Good then died, then it un-died.
reviewDescription: Was a good keyboard, then suddenly the "Enter" key (both on the keyboard and number pad) failed. I restarted the PC and unplugged and move the USB plug and still nada. Has to be something within it's logic board.  Plugged another keyboard in and it works without any issues. If you are looking for a long last investment, I can't recommend this keyboard.Update:  I later moved the keyboard to several USB ports and then back to original - and now it is working.  I could use the word "intermittent".  You mileage may vary.

I have been using this keyboard for 5 days and am not very pleased with it. The "R" key only works a fraction of the time which is not conducive to working on a computer. The battery died after 2.5 days of use with no warning. The colors are ok, nothing fancy. All of the keys have a gummy feel to them when pressed even after nearly a week. I was looking for an inexpensive wireless keyboard for work. Sadly I will be spending more as this isn't going to cut it.

The keyboard worked amazing for gaming for almost 2 years but within recent months, like within the last 6 or so, the keyboard keeps disconnecting from my laptop mid game. I was so happy when I initially got this but now I'm questioning if I should have ordered a different one with how this one is working currently.

reviewTitle: Some of the lettering was worn off
reviewDescription: Some of the lettering/symbols are worn off.  As if it was a used keyboard.  Functional still but this was rather annoying.
Keys lose printing and become impossible to see after a few months of use. Keys are just big colored blobs and had to get new keyboard.
What I said. lol. Every time I push the space bar it squeaks and it drives me nuts.

reviewTitle: Keyboard is great, packaging and delivery not so much...
reviewDescription: This product was delivered to my house 3 days early, which was nice, except its packaging was just the keyboard package. And by that I mean literally just the commerical package that they keyboard comes in,  which is pretty thin cardboard. Basically just that and a very thin sleeve of foam around the keyboard is all that's protecting it. The box itself is poorly secured. I expected it to at least be taped, to have some form of security, but it is unfortunately not. One side is coming apart and the other is torn up as if someone tried to open it, so now I really have no idea whether or not its been been tampered with and/or damaged. The keycap remover that is included also fell out when I picked it up, due to the box being practically open. Not a fan of the condition it arrived in, to say the least.Other than that, the keyboard itself gets 5 stars, as it meets all expectations. Big fan of how it looks and feels. Functions very well when I'm typing up my college essays or gaming. The keys are satisfying, as are the lights, and I like the fact that you can change the color settings. It works just fine with my Dell laptop, and its pretty good price-wise. We'll see how long it lasts.
Some keys broke after 2 days especially the W key, just replaced the switches and fixed it.

reviewTitle: It's good but missing back light always on feature
reviewDescription: Why does back light turnitself off after a minute?

Love the LED light option - makes working a little more fun - especially with three options plus the option to turn the LED off. I also like the heft of this (are gamers rough on their keyboards or something - this is one sturdy keyboard!).  What I hate. The "r" key does not type "r" consistently. This is awful for work as I need to type pretty fast and the "r" makes an appearance 50% of the time. With a boss whose pet peeves includes typos and inaccuracy, this sort of stinks. It's also very loud (not sure why the description says quiet) - I don't have long nails and I don't pound my keys...maybe quiet for a gamer who punches the keyboard? I don't know but during virtual meetings, the mic just amplifies the loudness of my typing making taking notes distracting (and, no, I can't mute my mic as I am running the meetings). Unfortunately, I already discarded the box so returning would be a pain too. At least the price wasn't bad and I got same-day delivery - and the colored lights are pretty. On the flipside, with a fickle key and loudness, utility trumps pretty so I'll probably buy a new keyboard...maybe this time a brand I recognize.

reviewTitle: As long as you just need a Keyboard, it's alright
reviewDescription: It's not great to type on, but if you need a cheap wireless keyboard, it's not terrible. Typing on it is okay, and the backlighting isn't great but if you need it to see to type at night, it works for that. just don't expect other various features you might have on a higher end keyboard. it's Alright and that's all it needs to be for my needs.

reviewTitle: Kinda poor design for fighting games
reviewDescription: I personally use this keyboard for playing fighting games. The issue comes whenever I try to do a crouching input. If I hold directly down, I can input fine, but down+left(numpad 5+4)/down+right(numpad 5+6) means my attack input (V) doesn't go through. Keyboard is very pretty though, quiet as well.
Didn't work very well.

reviewTitle: Great keyboard but doesn't hold up on the buttons
reviewDescription: So I am using this for work and the black part of the buttons are already wearing off. So that I can't see the letters very well. Should last longer than a few months. Now buying stickers to use on the keys so you can tell what letter they are.
My keys didn't work, the lights would lock to one color and not be able to switch.
Decent keyboard but back lights are too bright under the keys and don't show enough light through the keys. Wouldn't buy again for my purpose.

reviewTitle: Letters on keycaps not well lit
reviewDescription: This keyboard has a good feel when I type, and I'm sure I'll appreciate the spill-proof feature, but I'm disappointed in how dim the lighting of the letters and numbers are on the keycaps. (Yes, I've run the brightness up to full.) I'm a touch typist, but there are many times when I need to look at the keys, specifically the numbers. I wish the keycap lettering were more distinct. The lighting is very bright _around_ the keys.

The keyboard is exactly as advertised. Except it doesn’t work half the time. It shows the lights but the buttons don’t click half the time. Even turning off and on after so many minutes will stop. Including plugged in or not. Just not what I was hoping for.
The lights will time out after a few minutes of inactivity. There is no setting to keep the lights on indefinitely.

reviewTitle: Great but the in on the keys rubs off
reviewDescription: I bought this keyboard for use while working in the office (2 days a week) April 2022. Then I switched to having it at home where I work (2 days a week now).I really liked this keyboard it is fun and comfortable but after a few months of use the keys were starting to lose their paint and that has only gotten worst over a year later. Luckily I don't need to know where the keys are since I know how to type but if this was for a family computer setup then it wouldn't work for my daughter since she hasn't learned typing. Yet but will be soon.

I'm an old man but like to play games on pc. The keyboard would shut the lights off after about 20 seconds if no input. But while playing Diablo 4, the lights would go out after 3 seconds. Yes, I timed it. Very annoying. So I thought the battery was getting low as a red light would let me know. No red light but I charged it anyway. Unplugged it and once again did the lights go out after a few seconds. So while it was great at first, I seriously doubt I'll get another of this brand.
Garbage.  Stopped working after two months and won't charge or connect or anything.  Trash.

I loved that color, that's about it.  Didn't like the feel of the keys and HATED the font. It looked like some letters were already worn out.  I returned it.  I am rating it a 3 because it worked fine for the 5 min it was plugged in 🤭
This keyboard loses USB connectivity fairly often. It's a matter of unplugging, then re-connecting to yhe USB port.

reviewTitle: Not as good as previous ones,,,
reviewDescription: I bought this same model about 5 years ago and loved it till it would not stay charged anymore and bought a new one this one the V key takes 4 to 5 times to actually type it and the keys are only backlit but the characters are not lit so the backlight is basically useless now I just swapped the keys from my old one over so not that big of a deal for me. If I did not have the old one I would return this one.

reviewTitle: It's alright but the battery saving features can cause problems
reviewDescription: When I first got this keyboard I was glad to finally have a keyboard that didn't seem to have the connection interference problems with other main brand keyboards. If you do any kind of gaming, the keyboard and mouse have kind of a delay before it registers as it they have to "wake" up before if you don't use it within a short period of time. There is also this weird problem where the keyboard can be charged and the connection will get kind of wonky for lack of a better word where you have to turn the keyboard off and on to get it to behave again. The keyboard's battery (the mouse appears to last a little longer) will only last a couple of days before it has to be recharged.

My only real complaint regarding this keyboard, and the whole reason I chose this one, was the LED Backlit feature. Now I must admit it does have various options for the LEDs, however, none of that really matters if the LEDs automatically turn off just after a few minutes. Yes, they come back on as soon as you hit a key, but that's not so helpful when you are in a darken room with only your monitor as light. It does what I need, the light options are great, but I chicken peck my keyboards so I require them to be always lit.

reviewTitle: Love the lights but difficult to see the letters.
reviewDescription: I love the colorful glowing lights and the feel of the keys when typing. However, I had to purchase stickers and glue them on the keys because I couldn’t make out the letters/characters.  The letters are too faint to see, especially in daylight/office light.  They might be visible if you’re working in complete darkness, but I rarely do that.

Some people might like this, but I found the key position to be uncomfortably high up, making it difficult and even painful to type effectively.I do like the softness of the key strokes. If the keys were in a comfortable position I would have kept the keyboard and been happy with it.
Found this at Dollar Tree for 5 dollars and at Dollar General for 12 dollars. Works ok , a little hard to read letters depending on lighting. Works good in the dark. I bought 2 so over payed twice.

reviewTitle: A Good Gaming Keyboard Depending on Your Gaming Genre
reviewDescription: This NPET K10 Gaming Keyboard is an excellence product with an issue that may affect some users.  The keyboard has great features, and the responsiveness of the keys easily makes the user believe that it could last for years to come.  As well, the led colors are very bright, and the keys are easily accessible for both use and cleaning.  I have used the keyboard daily for over a month and my impressions are the following:Pros:-  IP32 Spill Resistant-  5 LED Backlighting Modes-  7 LED Breathing Colors-  Wear Resistant Keycaps-  Quiet Key OperationCons:-  Occasional Multi-Key Pressing Issues-  LED Colors No Solid Theme Throughout-  Key Cap WearOverall:This NPET K10 Gaming Keyboard has a good cost/benefit, at this price point it.  However, there were some combinations of key, multi-key, pressing issues with certain games.  Such issues are seen when playing some games, but absent when playing most others.  I only had an issue with the keyboard when playing two of many games.  Moreover, such issues may also arise when using the keyboard for general use programs that require three or more function/hotkey combinations.  Therefore, I had to take off two stars because of the Cons listed above.  However, I still recommend it if you are mindful of the points above.

For the price, it's exactly what you get. The one I got started to glitch if the light under the keys was alternating anything past the passed setting. Also, you cannot chose a color.  It's always rainbow.  Other than the alternating colors all the time and can't chose a solid color it works. But I'm not expecting a year of use from it.

I was excited to have a new keyboard and but things went downhill after I got it. I have only had it for three days. The keys stick, the space key squeaks, the power switch wants to be touchy. It could be me but personally I wouldn't buy again. Price was great and the lights are lovely.

reviewTitle: Looks good but doesn’t feel good
reviewDescription: Ok, so this keyboard is bright and looks great. The thing I don’t like is how it feels when I’m pressing the keys. The keys are big and it doesn’t have a nice sound to them, if that makes sense, lol.  I understand that you get what you pay for.

reviewTitle: Works alright for the price, except when it decides not to work.
reviewDescription: I bought this knowing it was cheaply-made, because all I wanted was a cheap keyboard. It's not that I'm surprised I'm having issues, it's more that I'm having such severe issues so immediately. Since the first day of using this keyboard I've had issues with random, inexplicable, constant key-presses that require fiddling around in weird ways to correct (holding the key down, yoinking out the key in question, prodding the key input pad with a knife, etc). The most recent was my E key deciding to spam itself ad infinitum while I was in the middle of some rather urgent conversation. I haven't gotten the keyboard dirty; the issues were in fact present on the first day of usage, so I can't blame that. Aside from the random infinite key press issue, though, I'd say it works pretty great; the lights are wonderful (though I wasn't exactly focused on those when purchasing the item) and the keys type smoothly. But I did nearly send a 4,300-character message consisting entirely of the number five because of this keyboard, and it has a fondness for randomly activating my browser's bookmarks shortcut on loop until I press the activating keys hard enough to convince it to stop. I'd say it's a great purchase if you're waiting for the funds to buy a keyboard that isn't as frustrating.

reviewTitle: Edited: I knew it was too good to be true, buyer be ware!
reviewDescription: I am in the market for a new keyboard and when I stumbled upon this one I thought there had to be a catch as this package included everything I wanted. I wanted a keyboard with RGB backlit keys and a palm rest. This one shipped with those features plus included a mouse and even mouse pad. What's more, it was priced at a mere 25 dollars.I should have known something was wrong, but when I researched the product on Amazon I saw hundreds of glowing reviews and/or 5-star ratings so I thought it was safe to buy this product. Unfortunately, I was duped.This keyboard was sold as new, but as soon as I opened the package I saw it had clearly been previously used. The space key and a spring were completely detached from the keyboard. There were scratches and other signs of wear on the logo that sat atop they keyboard. What bothered me most though were the disgusting grease spots that were still present on the keyboard from whomever had previously owned the thing. I shoved this piece of trash back in the box it arrived in and requested a full refund within 10 minutes of receiving the delivery. This was by far the worst condition of any product I've ever purchased on Amazon. I will never buy from this brand again.Edit: On June 4th the seller shipped a free replacement of this item to me. Although I had already purchased a new keyboard I did agree to update my review if/when the replacement item arrived - if it warranted an updated review. I am happy to report it does deserve a second chance. The company rectified its mistake and I am sufficiently satisfied with the keyboard I received. It's a basic 20-dollar keyboard with LED lights that breathe, although you can turn the LED's off, lower their intensity or slow their rate of breathing. The mousepad and mouse are nice additions to this package and make this a great value. I had to order another keyboard because my initial order shipped defective, so this keyboard won't be the one I use on a day to day basis. However, I will admit you can do a lot worse than this Npet offering and for the price, I am not sure there is a better value readily available as new. Because of their customer service I have upgraded my initial rating from 1-star to 3-stars.

I bought this a year ago and loved it. With the push to go back to the office, I bought another one, so I don’t have to transfer. I ordered the same one as last time but reciever a completely different keyboard.  It looks weird but seems to work fine.  We will see. It doesn’t look like the picture on the website.

reviewTitle: This keyboard shuts itself off randomly.
reviewDescription: Its almost like its on a sleep timer . If you dont use it for a few it shuts off . I have reached out to the manufacturer about this to find out if I have a defective one or if its normal for this model. No response so I'm returning it. If you dont care that it shuts off randomly , it is a nice keyboard . Its quite , has a small footprint and when it is lit up , it gets all the keys pretty good . I used mine for over a week thinking I could get used to it shutting off but no , I need mine to stay on or have a way to stop the sleep timer if that is whats happening .

It looks nice but for pure gaming it's a NO-GO for me.Certain button combinations don't function, example: If you hold Shift+W then try to press H the keyboard does not respond.  You have to release Shift or W for the keyboard to activate whatever command is assigned to H.Also the LEDs turn off automatically after 5 min or so... :|
Love that this keyboard goes to sleep when when not in use.
This keyboard and wrist pad is awesome. The added bonus is the lights under the keys.
Worked for a temp fix

The keys have good key travel and sound amazing. Love the LED lights as well and the keyboard feels sturdy. Battery life is amazing and I haven’t charged it since opening it. Overall great keyboard for the price.

This keyboard works amazing and I bought it years ago. The most that might go wrong would be 4 magnets on the back slipping off because the glue wore down but you can just gorilla glue it to the keyboard and problem solved. Also there are 3 color settings as well as a complete off setting if you don't like all the colors.
I am impressed with the light-up color. No more batteries. This keyboard has a long-lasting charge.

reviewTitle: As nice as any I've ever owned
reviewDescription: Have never owned super premium but have owned nice keyboards. This is on par or better than those.
The design and execution of this product is outstanding. It is beautiful and my kids loves the keyboard! The foam feels like heaven when I have my wrist resting on it.
Looks good and works as intended.
Nice for the price

reviewTitle: Good budget keyboard with one terminal caveat
reviewDescription: ***UPDATED REVIEW***I've been using this keyboard as a daily driver for about three months now (purchased in mid-September 2022, now mid-December 2022). It works as intended and has a lot going for it (see original review below). However, the black paint on the keys is wearing off so that I can't read the characters anymore. It's disappointing that the company made such an otherwise great keyboard but because they cut corners with the design of the keys, the keyboard STILL ends up being disposable. And this after JUST THREE MONTHS. So here I am, back on Amazon looking for another keyboard. :(If you can afford it, spend your money on a premium product that will last years. This, sadly, isn't it.***ORIGINAL REVIEW***In the past five years, I've gone through two dozen keyboards. Most of the wireless ones just don't work reliably. BT cuts out. To conserve energy, they turn off after a couple of minutes--leading to mistakes when you start typing again due to the re-connection lag. Batteries die at the least convenient times. Etc. This keyboard offers the reliability of an always-ready wired connection. And the back-lighting means I can work in any light conditions because the light turns OFF or I can adjust the light intensity up/down. While the springiness of the keys isn't as sharp as, for me, the gold standard--the Lenovo classic Thinkpad keypad--it's far better than most other keyboards' anemic, wishy-washy , did-I-actually-just-depress-that-key? feel.  The feel isn't as sharp as that of other gaming keyboards', though--if that's critical to you. It's quiet enough to be used in a room with other people without being a nuisance, and springy enough to give you an immediate "feel" that each key has been depressed.Another huge plus for this keyboard is how intuitive it is to change the lighting. You just use the clearly designated FN key and the PG UP/PG DOWN keys. These latter have the light-icons with either "-" or "+" also printed on them. And unlike other keyboards, all these keys are illuminated--not just the letters but the symbols too.For the price, this keyboard can't be beat. I'd even buy these for others for gifts--a solid, reliable, no-nonsense product. If you're sick of dealing the the prima dona wireless keyboards but sill want to be able to work in low-light conditions, this is a terrific keyboard. I'll update my review if anything major changes.

I bought this for work, and loved the fact that it was wireless. I could re-adjust it in so many ways on my desk, or even on my lap. But after about 2 weeks with it, the charge no longer wanted to last a full 8 hour work shift, and I had to plug it in just to finish out the last hour of the day. The following days, the charge lasted shorter and shorter, such that I now just keel it plugged in at all times. It's a shame really.I have issues also with some of the keys sticking, for example I will press space, and it will give me about 10 spaces.Lastly, I just want to point out that the glowing colors look best in the dark. Every once in a blue moon, we keep the office lights off, but for the most part, everybody seems to always want the lights on, and then I hardly notice the beautiful colors. Not the keyboards fault really, but food for thought for anyone who is considering this keyboard for similar office use. I will be replacing this keyboard very soon. Hopefully the new one corrects all these issues.

reviewTitle: Failed in less than a year.
reviewDescription: I bought this keyboard for my living room PC, and as such it experienced a few falls from about a 3 feet height. Despite that, It continued working perfectly for months. I was impressed with its apparently good build quality. That is, until today, when it failed to charge the battery. I tried several different cables and chargers, but the problem seems to be internal, because the little red LED on the back does not light up when the charger is connected anymore. So now the keyboard is dead.

reviewTitle: Cheap backlit keyboard and it feels like it.  Rainbow LED colors, cannot change to a solid color.
reviewDescription: This review is for NPET K10 Wired Backlit keyboardShort version - looks cool from a distance.  But is miserable to type on and the LEDs lack adjustability.  Ok for your 10 year old to beat on.Looks OK, and for under $15 what do you want?  Well, I for one would LOVE to be able to change the rainbow brite backlights to one single color.  Blue, red, etc, something.  I have not discovered a way to do this.  The instructions say (and comments on reviews are the same) that FN+Page UP changes LED modes.  This did nothing for me, as far as I can tell FN+Page UP = brightness UP, FN+Page DN = brightness down.  The "LED" light key (directly above the HOME key turns the LEDs on or off, or through one of 3 rainbow modes.  Note, these are STATIC rainbow modes, it doesn't shift or change colors.  If you FN+LED or FN+HOME, it enters a "breathing mode" where the lights pulse in and out.  THAT IS IT.The printed and online instructions are wrong, or maybe for a different model keyboard.FN+↑ =light up = WRONG, this is actually FN+PG UPFN+↓=light down = WRONG, this is actually FN+PG DNFN+HM=7 constant colors (7 modes) = WRONG, enters breathing modeFN+PD=turn off the light = WRONG, this dims the LED lighting brightnessFN+INS=LED colors cycling = WRONG, this does NOTHINGFN+PU=Customized led lighting =  WRONG, this increases the LED lighting brightnessFN+DEL=Running RGB lighting (2 modes) = WRONG, this does NOTHINGFN+END=7 colors/1 colors breathing (8 modes) = WRONG, this does NOTHINGFN+«=LED spreading/breathing speed down = I don't even know what key this refers to.  Cursor?  If so, does nothing.FN+»=LED spreading/breathing speed up = I don't even know what key this refers to.  Cursor?  If so, does nothing.LED lighting aside. ... there is no height adjustment at all.  Even $10 keyboards come with little legs in the back to heighten or lower the keyboard typing angle.  NONE here.These keys... SPRINGY and SPONGY are the best words I can describe them.  Not predictably mushy like an OEM HP/DELL/ETC keyboard... but... bouncy?  Anyway... not great.  Oh, so many many typos I made while typing this.  Not enjoyable to type on at all.  And the keys are... raised?  Tall?  I don't know the best description, but they sit a lot higher than you would expect.It sort of looks like a mechanical keyboard, but with zero of the feel.All I wanted was an inexpensive, mediocre, backlit keyboard to use at work in a dark room.  Just typing this review.... no way I'm taking this junk to work.  So uncomfortable to type on and you're locked into rainbow mode.  Not worth my time or effort to return this thing... it will likely wind up in the dumpster or at Goodwill.Is it better or worse than the other sub $20 LED keyboards?  Hard to say.

Overall I do like the keyboard set up. I have purchased 3 in the past year and all 3 the keys have worn out-only some of them but they just stop working and the riser feet break and won't adjust after just a few days of use. I thought I just got a couple of "bad" boards but this continues to happen. I like the taller keys but it's not worth it to keep paying time and time again for a product that continues to stop working correctly.

It's an attractive keyboard. I do like how it is backlit. But it is NOT quiet by any means. And I have only had it for about two months and the space bar now squeaks. Given that I work from home and I am typing on it 5 days a week, this squeak is driving me up a wall. Especially since I was already disappointed due to how loud it already was. I was trying to get a QUIET keyboard so it wouldn't wake my baby while she napped. However, this is not the one for that. If you don't mind the noise, or the squeak, it's a great keyboard.

reviewTitle: Back-light turns off when not typing
reviewDescription: This keyboard would be great, except that it goes into sleep mode after 2-3 minutes, which turns off the back-light until a key is pressed. I searched online twice and could not find a way to disable this function. If you need this for a dark environment, look elsewhere.

reviewTitle: The letters on the keys are really poorly printed
reviewDescription: The letters on the keys are really poorly printed And smeared.Its a good thing I dont have to look at the keys to know where I am at but everyone else in the house has to look and there is an endless battle of trying to figure out whats what.

reviewTitle: Only charged on time after the initial charge.
reviewDescription: I loved it while it worked! But after the 1st recharge, it only worked a short time and then suddenly died. Now it won't charge. I tried contacting the company but have not received a response.

reviewTitle: Cool LED features but keyboard can be annoying for touch typists
reviewDescription: Keyboard is bright and works great plug and play. However, in order to get the lighting feature, the keys have been raised up above normal height, which means for me as a touch typist that the bottoms of my hands regularly hit the control and shift keys accidentally which leads to all sorts of annoyances that I need to go back and correct, hot keys that send an email before I am ready, etc. I'm pretty shocked at the overall rating of this keyboard given that, in my view, it performs poorly on the one thing it really needs to do well.But the lights are cool I guess?

reviewTitle: Bright Colors, Great Feel to the Keys
reviewDescription: I’m not a gamer. I’m just an old school person who loves to feel and hear the keys click beneath my fingers. The only tiny thing is some of the keys squeak a bit but I don’t care. I’m in love with my keyboard!!
good quality for the price
This is a Christmas gift for my grandson .  A gift he specifically asked for.  I am sure he will love it.

Plugs in  and worked right away to replace the keyboard on my laptop that was dysfunctional.  It did take a while to figure out some features but no big deal.  I would buy again.  It actually is way better than the keyboard I was using on the laptop.
I love that the keyboard lights up.

Very cool keyboard, love the rainbow lights n the way the keys click. I can't sadly fit it under my desk I use, but I would probably be happy to use it with a different desk later on or give it as a gift to my little bro

reviewTitle: I’m in love with this keyboard!!
reviewDescription: This keyboard is a perfect low-cost option for anyone wanting a gaming keyboard or just a fun, customizable basic keyboard! The light features are customizable in 7 different color options and has a color meshing feature which is very aesthetically pleasing. In addition it has the perfect built in switches for all the keys so each key makes a sound that is nice to hear but is not overly loud. Very pleased with this purchase!!
This keyboard is nice and I loved how it lights up! Very easy to used ✅

Alright, either the Matrix is messing with my mind or I've genuinely had this for a long time. I remember order this like 1-2 months ago but my order says I've had this keyboard for almost 2 years. I don't remember getting this keyboard that long ago but I'll tell you my experience.It's been used to say the least and only up until I did a new computer build did it start going haywire on me. I'm not able to use Shift+T on this keyboard and this was the first problem (other than the paint of the key caps rubbing off) in the span of 2 years. To say the least, I just ordered two more of these and am currently leaving this review after looking up the order date on it. It lasted almost twice as long as my $200 keyboard that I got before it and I gotta say that I got a lot more value out of it.

This keyboard for $20 is an absolute steal. There are a variety of LED modes that you can use, including the Fn M3 mode where you can customize the layout of the LED colors throughout the keyboard. The keys also feel really nice to type on and they are not very loud. A must-buy.

I got this keyboard for pretty cheap because a mechanical keyboard is a lot more expensive, so I settled for this one because I saw good things. However, the key paint began to scrape off less than a month after purchase, the lights are starting to fade, and the key caps are even coming off. Very cheaply made. Worst part is, all I’ve done is kept it on my desk and have barely touched it. Gaming on it really wears it down quick. I wouldn’t recommend this if you’re looking to play games or type lots of essays such as myself, being a student and all.

I just got the keyboard yesterday 08/27/2020 and the K key keeps spamming my when i try to try into anything or just does it on its own. I tried to take it out blow it out and it still does it. I had this keyboard for 1 day and it already is acting up. I wouldn't recommend this, now i can see why its on sale. Its hard to determine things by reviews anymore because people get free stuff if the leave good reviews. But if you don't wanna waste your time please don't buy this, Now i have to wait who knows how long for another keyboard. It lights up great and has good colors but that's the only thing going for it. Its slim compared to my last keyboard i had.
the letters and numbers used most frequently wore off very quickly
Ive been using this keyboard for 1 year and the black coating is wearing off which blurs the appearance of the letters.

reviewTitle: Awesome Keyboard for the 6 months it lasted
reviewDescription: Loved this keyboard the minute I plugged it into my desktop computer.  It looks beautiful all lit up.  The keys were easy to use.  The setup was not simple.  While it worked it was tremendous.However, out of nowhere the keyboard suddenly started typing the letter "K" repeatedly whenever I used that letter.  Even worse, anytime I used the other letters surrounding the letter "k" on the keyboard (u,i,o,l,m) the ltter "k" was inserted:  example - "Bokught a new kkkeybokard.  As you might see the lketter "K" is randomly shokwing up whenever i use lketters ikn the mikddlke okf the kkkeybokard."

reviewTitle: Far from quiet and you have to hit the spacebar dead on
reviewDescription: I am not sure why this is labeled as a quiet keyboard, it is far from quiet.  It isn't quite as clicky sounding as a mechanical keyboard but it is louder than normal keyboards.  So typing on meetings is distracting.The brightness of the LED is so/so, and you can't really adjust it.  I thought you could, maybe I'm missing something.My biggest complaint with this keyboard is you have to hit the spacebar dead on for it to register.  Hitting the spacebar on the edges will not be enough pressure to register.  For fast typists, this is incredibly annoying.This turd is going back. :(

reviewTitle: Don’t judge a book by its cover
reviewDescription: Right off the bat, I opened it and it was gorgeous. It’s weighted really nicely, the keys felt amazing and bouncy and I plugged it in and it lit up and was so beautiful. I was so excited....then I went to go use it and almost all of the buttons on the left side were broken. None of them worked. I should have read the reviews because all the 1 stars say that the board was defective or they had it for a couple months and the keys just started dying. I’m super bummed. I emailed the seller but I’m gonna go ahead and return it because I don’t want another one and a month later I’m stuck with a broken keyboard that I can’t return.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
reviewDescription: This product will work for a few months then randomly stop connecting. Since July of 2021 we have went through 3 of these (2 of which were replacements sent by the company). The keyboard suddenly won’t hold a charge. It’s rather frustrating because we keep having to replace the keyboard. It seems as if the lifespan of these are around 6 months.

reviewTitle: It's an old model the company doesn't support it.
reviewDescription: Really sad the company doesn't have the drivers for it . Really you don't have enough storage space on your site . So very sad. The drivers for the model T20 are available but don't work for this model. Will it work yes but for a multi media keyboard all the multi media features on the keyboard are not available. So , I would look elsewhere. And maybe avoid the company as they don't support what they sell.Since i don't really care about the multimedia features I like the keyboard , led is bright the keys feel great

Unfortunately I had to return this keyboard because several of the keys simply didn't work. My keyboard had stopped working and I opted for ordering online because I was able to get same day delivery and really didn't feel like running to a store (or stores) to find one. I was a bit excited about having a keyboard that lit up, and I really liked the 'water-resistant' feature.I ended up waiting all day only to end up having to go out after dinner to grab the first keyboard I could find.Oh well... it was on sale for very little and I guess that should have been an indication.At least the return was very easy.

reviewTitle: It just stopped working after4 months.
reviewDescription: It just stopped working after4 months. It appears to recharge but just won't light up and keys don't work. Tried contacting support but no response so far from company.
Not as impressed with this keyboard as I thought I would be. A little higher keyboard and keys than I thought and the keys take a little more pressure to type, almost like old electric type writers.

This has been the most frustrating purchase in a while! I have charged it for 8 hours and it lights up for 2 seconds and cuts off!  I’m hopeful it is not me that is doing something wrong but have read all instructions and it’s a no go! Returning

I really wanted to enjoy this keyboard, but the keys are way too tall. Noise is also not as quiet as I was thinking it was going to be. Just not the right ergonomics for me at all. The legs on the back only lift it up about 1/16 of an inch.Lights up plenty bright, lithium battery is great, easy plug and play usb receiver. Everything I wanted at a good price. Just not right for me.

I really enjoyed this keyboard. The feel was tremendous, exactly what you'd want from a mechanical keyboard. I used it about two hours a day for six months, but only for regular typing, never for gaming. The use was pretty darn mild.Yesterday, every time I typed a "c" I instead saw a "cf" on the screen. I figured that there must have been some bizarre error, so I typed an "f" to see what happened. Sure enough, I'd get a "cf" a handful of times, then the cursor would stop, then I'd get an "f" by itself. Obviously this doesn't work.I tried all of the fixes that made any sense. I cleaned the keyboard, turned it upside down and shook it out, uninstalled and reinstalled the drivers. Nothing worked. The keys don't have any obvious physical issues. They're not sticky. They don't depress together. There's just something wrong internally.So, six months of strong results followed by uselessness. 1.5 stars sounds right, so I rounded up to 2.

Cheap and colorful garbage. terrible at holding a charge, charges so slowly you cant use it while its charging or it will keep dying. also quite a few dead keystrokes unless you type angry. dont fall for the cheap price tag, its junk.

reviewTitle: Enter key started sticking less than 90 days after receiving the keyboard
reviewDescription: LED lights stopped working and enter key started sticking less than 90 days after receiving it.  I would like a new one sent under warranty.
After 3 months Keyboard will no longer charge or power up just gonna throw it away
