reviewTitle: I used this keyboard for office work but is not working after a few months. Very sad!
reviewDescription: The keyboard is not working after a few months.

reviewTitle: I can not get the numbers keypad to work
reviewDescription: I can not get the numbers keypad to work and my send it back because of it,,

reviewTitle: This keyboard is quirky but for $18.00... Must read below if considering this item.
reviewDescription: I'm not a gamer, bought it so I can see at night as my laptop is not backlit. At first it seemed to work OK. charged it the 4 hrs. Like it said. The owner's manual is lame, much lost in translation and very short.I was about to send it back as it would not stay on, it would light up for a second and shut down. After much frustration and and a trip across the room into the wall, I discovered how tough this thing really is.The bottom line is you MUST have your computer on with the USB receiver / "dongle" plugged in for the keyboard to function. Must be a battery conserving feature or something  but manual never mentions this. I give it 5 stars for toughness, zero for all the brain damage it caused me, 3 for cool looking but 2 for lighting as the keys on the top 2 rows are more dim than the rest. Even after trying to destroy it, it works perfectly now that all the keys are back in place. Hey, for 18 bucks, why not! I'm keeping mine. If it breaks, Best Buy recycles E-waste from China too. Updated on 01/05/2023: So far, I''m pleased with battery life. I use the provided USB cable and charge using my laptop. Would NOT recommend using a cell phone charger... End of edit.

This keyboard was advertised as quiet, but it was much louder than even my mechanical keyboard. The space bar also felt a bit weird. If noise isn't a problem, this keyboard is fine. You can definitely get better for cheaper though.

reviewTitle: Nice, but letters wear off quickly
reviewDescription: I loved the keyboard at first.  Within 2 weeks, the letters on the keys were rubbing off.  I loved the different lighting and the ability to raise and lower the brightness of the backlights.
It lags and when tapping on the keys it's not very intuitive. I do not recommend.

reviewTitle: Nice Keyboard Terrible Mouse Button Placement Design
reviewDescription: The keyboard is nice and I like the feel of the buttons. The only issue is the mouse. They placed the Forward and back buttons where I constantly keep hitting them when I go to grab the mouse or by just simply navigating a page. It gets extremely annoying when it happens on a page that does not save your info if you press the back button.

There is light under the keyboard, but its not actually backlit in the sense that typing at night isnt easier on this keyboard. The actual characters on the keyboard are not illuminated. That was cheap. Also you cant do flat colors which is silly.
i like it for what i need.  I have a different keyboard for my tower that clik claks.  This is silent, so at night i'm not making that much noise.

reviewTitle: lovin' the colors once I figured it out...
reviewDescription: I am loving the light settings one I figured out how to change them since the manual indicates that an LED button is how you change them but that's not the case... Thankfully the internet had the answer and I was able to figure out that it's FN + MS keys (the insert, home, est buttons).Also... Buttons are loud and sometimes stick.But overall, not a bad purchase for the money and an entry level RGB keyboard.

reviewTitle: Not to thrilled with this keyboard - key stuck, riser does not angle enough, material fair quality
reviewDescription: The small bottom risers do not angle the keyboard high enough to make a difference and the U key keeps sticking. I did not check into this earlier since I just started my online class so I cannot exchange it anymore. Seems like the quality of the plastic is not too durable.  I am not recommending this at this time.

I wanted a backlit keyboard to view the keys better.  This was more light around the keys than illuminating the actual keys letters.  The key letter was crudely made with sometimes missing sections.  The keys worked on the PC, however.  Very long key stroke will take some getting used to after having use a laptop.

reviewTitle: The response from the keys are great.....see below
reviewDescription: I have just opened up and have not really worked with it.  One is my reasons for choosing this type of keyboard was because my finger nails are longer and this actually allows me to keep the at the current length.  I know it sounds petty but I'm doing me.  So far it is working out for me.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for with this keyboard
reviewDescription: It looks very aesthetically pleasing with the rainbow LEDs to backlight the keys. It is also listed at an affordable price on this site. However, the quality is a big issue with degrading performance over time. After about six months of regular use on my desktop, the space bar and a couple of other keys do not get triggered correctly or are stuck. This leads to me typing things like the following: "myLaTeXformulais sogreatI,wait,whyis everything ononeline?!?". Needless to say, you get what you pay for out of a low price bargain keyboard. I am now having to buy another more expensive, better quality keyboard that I wish I had known to buy the first time.

reviewTitle: Bad paint quality and key strokes
reviewDescription: The backlighting was a must have so that I can see the keys as I like to live in a cave sometimes. However after only a couple weeks of use, I notices the paint started to rub off on the 'S' key. some of the other keys started to show wear as well. The paint quality is just poor. You can see that the spray must just be over the top as there is white plastic under the keys with overspray. The other issue is the keys are fairly stiff. There was some resistance to them so faint key clicks sometimes dont register.

This keyboard is okay, for 15$ I'd say it's pretty expensive but it gets the job done. No delay, lag, or a key inputting wrong keys, etc. Just one problem... I game alot and due to my sweat it seems as if the keys s, d, c, v and even the spacebar is losing its paint! Although this has to effect on performance it looks very unpleasing. Another thing to add is more customizable colors and maybe include a mouse with the keyboard for 15$? Maybe I'm just asking for too much but overall it's been good been using for 1 month and a half.

reviewTitle: Please read if you’re thinking of buying this.
reviewDescription: If you scrolling the reviews and deciding if you want to buy this keyboard, just remember that it is a 20$ keyboard so don’t set expectations too high. First off the keys are a little cheap for example some lights look kinda dimmer than others. The keys feel pretty good if the back-stands are up, that make it pretty comfortable. The keyboard LED’s to me look kinda cheesie, you only have about 4 options to customize this keyboard.These are the color options:1. Blue, red, and green.2. Blue, purple, and yellow.3. Green, blue, and red.Then you have a color breathing option that basically switches between the 3 options of colors.(really disappointing)The only positive thing I can say about this keyboard is how it feels, which pretty aright for gaming.Overall, this keyboard is not bad for 20 dollars as for quality but I wouldn’t recommend it just because of the LEDs that make my build look like toy.

reviewTitle: Nice clicks, but letters already wearing off
reviewDescription: This statement in the review:Wear Resistant Doubleshot ABS Keycaps: The keycaps feature a special coating to protect the keyboard for many years.Maybe they forgot the coating on mine but I've only had this keyboard 4 months and the S key is already worn and the A is on its' way out.
Was looking forward to something new not bashed up, still works but looks like someone got hungry.

reviewTitle: It works, I like it - Not Fast Typing friendly
reviewDescription: The keyboard works, it's nice looking, but I have one problem with it. I typically type really fast and I have noticed that not all my keystrokes will input when I do that. I have had to slow down my typing, which is a minor thing really, I bought it for gaming.I love the raised keys, makes it feel kinda type writer-ish. The colors are nice, my daughter thinks it is fun to change the colors.
This was a solid keyboard for two years.  Now it disconnects and reconnects at random intervals.

Got this as a replacment for wired keyboard. So far liking it. Its got a 1600Mah built in rechargeable battery. Do not know low long that'll last with the RGB. Its not as bright as I want but guess thats a decent trade off since its powered by a small battery. Install was just plug and play, i disnt need any special driver disc or download. Oh, the plug for charging is USB-C.RGB lighting shuts off in a little over 2 minutes. Key presses feel a little gummy to me. My previous keyboard was mechanical and i guess was spoiled by it. I'd rate this wireless keyboard as just okay.

Quality is definitely a variable with this product. My boyfriend ordered this keyboard and I loved it for the price so I ordered one for myself. Mine is...fine, but definitely a step down in quality despite ordering it a day after he received his. My num pad is slanted to the right at a weird angle and the keys are not evenly coated in paint, so the light shines through various parts of the keys. Minor, but I think its worth calling out that quality is inconsistent so be prepared.

Loved it at first. Comfortable.  I like high set keys for typing and had bought a similar keyboard for WFH days.  This one however is not doing so well. Battery life has declined drastically and (check out the pic) the “paint” is coming off the keys.  This is only three months of use.  It was cheap.  And my wallet helped make this decision.

I bought this keyboard bc the gamer keyboards seem to be easier on the hands. the spacebar sticks on this one, so every few words the words run together and I have to go back and edit.  I have to hit the space bar really hard to get it to work so that's not ergonomic enough.  It's also quite loud, in fact people can hear me typing when I'm on a zoom call and that's unprofessional.

reviewTitle: Not a good keyboard for video games
reviewDescription: Originally, this keyboard was a good cheap option and it didn't feel too cheap. It was working fine for the first few months and then the WASD and space bar would get stuck or it would be delayed in game. This really effected how I played and made me have to consider buying a new keyboard. The LEDs are also cheap and the keys themselves aren't very good. The black paint on the keys has already started to come off. If you want this keyboard for day to day typing it should be fine, but for games I would not recommend it.

reviewTitle: Great keyboard but some letters already wearing off
reviewDescription: I love this keyboard unfortunately some of the letters are already wearing off. Good battery life. Cool lighting. Would love to have given it 5 stars if not for the paint wearing off after less than 2 months of use.**Updated....I still love this keyboard, unfortunately I am returning/replacing since more of the paint is coming off they keys. S is almost gone completely and at least 4 more now are starting to wear off. I am down grading to 2 stars. Hopefully the replacement one will be better

reviewTitle: why user can not see the battery level ?
reviewDescription: I bought the keyboard for work. And I get it at last weekend.  After chatting with the online association of Amazon, he told me that there should be one indicator light at the right top, when it is charging.  But I tried many chargers and lines, I did not see any indicator light as he mentioned, so he recommended that I send mail to the vendor directly to check what we should do next, I am waiting for the feedback …..

reviewTitle: Was great at first.. now I half my keys have blotches for characters
reviewDescription: I liked my first one, I bought one for work, and one for my kids computer.  fast forward a few month and I can not even see many of they key characters.  (esdnhla are all missing).  This is fine for me, but my daughter is still young and needs to look at her keys to see what to click  but hers are rubbing off as well. :( LAME

This keyboard WAS amazing. Great size, appealing to the eye, BUT if you actually want to use it, be ready to have to plug it in everyday....Out of the box, the battery lasted about 2 weeks...I have used the keyboard a few months now and I am plugging it in half way through one shift. Of course, I am now out of the return period.DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!
If you’re a quick worker you’ll be fairly unhappy.

reviewTitle: Hard to type but Star Wars cool
reviewDescription: I gave this a try cause it looks nice - and it DOES look nice.But looking nice is useless if it can’t do the job it’s supposed to do first - which is type things.The keys a really high and so your hand is at a funny angle I did not like it. Sorry I sent it backBut it does look like something out of Star Wars if that’s what you want.

reviewTitle: You pay for what you get
reviewDescription: Really not a bad looking keyboard for the price. Although My biggest reservation is battery life. I use this keyboard for my home office and i expected it to last for a good minute before i had to re charge it. not even a day later i had to re charge it and the worst part was when i did & i plugged it in it wouldn't function. needless to say this keyboard lives near the charger. For work i use my steel-series keyboard and you better believe if that didn't work my faith in tech would be gone lol.

reviewTitle: Last oe ill buy as i type tis
reviewDescription: Tis is te last oe ill buy  i my lie of work i deal wit moisture ad tis keyboard i 12 year as failed 5 times Tis is te last oe  Dot buy its ot water resistat at all tis sould be removed  Usually ill get 5 6 mots out of a keyboard tis oe is good if your i eed of a back up ot a mai work orse

No battery life status exists and the keyboard has no software to change any settingsbattery lasts less than 1 hour after fully charged and cannot be used while chargingI could either return it and get a different keyboard or buy a 2nd keyboard and switch them out every hourpro: its cheap

The "5" key was dead on arrival.  Other than that it looks like it would have been a good keyboard.  Alas, I cannot wait for another week for another Prime shipment to arrive so I'll be making the long drive into town to buy a keyboard from a big box store.  P.S., some folks have referenced this as a technical keyboard in their reviews.  It is not nor does the seller claim as much.  It is a mechanical "feel" keyboard.  You aren't getting a true mechanical at these prices.

Had it for a year and the paint on the keys has come off. It's a good thing I have the letters memorized cuz a good number of them are unreadable now. Save your money and buy something that'll last longer. Other than that, works like it's supposed to.

I have an older version of this key board on another computer. I liked it so much I ordered one as a gift and then one for work. But the new one the keys looks like the keys were spray painted and the paint is coming off a few keys, Its really sad when you find a good product then they start making it cheaper and now it isn't worth it any more.

I bought this keyboard to replace my older keyboard and it seemed to work well in the beginning. Unfortunately, as I played some games, I realized that the keyboard does not allow certain key combinations (in this case a+s+o). As a person who plays a lot of keyboard only games, this is a major issue as certain games simply cannot be played with this keyboard. If this matters to you, make sure to purchase an n rollover keyboard. If you only play keyboard and mouse games, this issue probably won't affect you.
Stopped working in less than 2 years time.

While the keyboard has a great response time, I have to say that it is NOT quiet like advertised. I've had this keyboard for 3 months now and my main complain is just how LOUD this keyboard is. I work from home right now and I get a lot of comments about how everyone can easily hear it (my husband complains about it all the time since we share an office).The other complaint is that after just 2 months, one of the keys started squeaking when pressed as well.

reviewTitle: It was nice while it lasted, but after 23 months it's a goner
reviewDescription: I bought this key board so I could work at my computer with the light off. It doesn't get abused at all but it only lasted 23 months. Now I'll type and nothing shows on the computer screen or else numbers or letters will replicate on their own like you're holding a key down when I'm no where close to the key board.I wouldn't buy this keyboard again.

reviewTitle: Great keyboard, but not reliable - products may be inconsistent...?
reviewDescription: It’s been 11 days. I used this keyboard daily, and never spilled water on it once. Then yesterday, while working, I notice the blue lights have faded, but I assume it’s simply because it’s been on too long, so I turn them off. Few minutes later, and the keyboard stops responding. I thought, hmm maybe I need to use the wire they gave to charge it, but no, I left it “charging for around some 13 hours and it still doesn’t turn on.It’s a great keyboard and I loved it, for the 11 days I did use it. I trust that the company can respond and maybe give some info on how I can fix this, since some of the other reviews tell me they got their problem solved or just got a replacement.Good keyboard, hopefully good customer service, but bad reliability from the looks of it. Gonna be nice and give them 3 stars for now. Will update
The keyboard it's pretty good feels solid, functioned well, nice backlights, unfortunately died after a year of use.

Pros: Keyboard angle is good, keys have good return, good spacing between keys and number pad is nice addition.  Cons: letters and black casing worn extensively, can't tell which keys are which. Back lighting does not go off when I turn off the computer, need to cover keyboard with a towel at night, too bright.

reviewTitle: No Scroll Lock.  Key characters dim.  Not true RGB.
reviewDescription: They didn't put a scroll-lock key on.  I couldn't tell that from the crappy image; it looks like it has one, but that is the LED dimmer key. Why make a key specific for that function when you can do function+key?Also, the lighting is spotty.  For instance, the Keys like the ESC key don't have their own backlight.  It is illuminated with whatever light is left over from the section of keys below. Some keys are bright enough, but others aren't.  *** If you turn off the LED key lighting, it can be hard to see what the keys are if the ambient light in the room is not bright.  The characters in the key caps are, sort of, "plastic milk jug" translucent.The colors for the lighting are *limited*, in *sections*, that will have two color choices max.  Mix and match those limited sections to get the seven possible combinations.Key feel is okay. Not clicky, but not quiet either.For the money it's an okay deal.

this was my first ever gaming keyboard. I personally use a Dell® but also use a Mac®. It worked fine with a Dell® but it glitched out the space key on Mac®.  If you use this for Mac® I do not recommend it though. The brightness is OK. But if you are looking for a starter and cheap keyboard you might want to use this. Just not on Mac.

I really love this keyboard, but 5 buttons stopped working after 2 months. I had to write this review with my back up keyboard. I purchased another one in hopes that i got a defective one because this keyboard is awesome. I will let you all know what happens with the other one.

Form factor of keys feel a little cheap. The lettering isn't the normal font so, if you want to use for other than gaming, you may find it a little difficult to translate. The lighting is where I wasn't happy.  It's just on and off.  I couldn't find any other options and if there are, there is no instructions for it.  It is nice it has riser adjustments if you want more of an angle.Bottom line, it is an inexpensive keyboard so, it's only going to have so many plusses. But, with a market that is saturated, it should have the basics in line
Turns off randomly.

reviewTitle: Inexpensive keyboard and it feels like it
reviewDescription: I bought this thinking it would be almost as good as the famous inexpensive boards like red dragon, etc. I was wrong. It doesn't have a good typing feel at all, there is basically no customization to the light patterns (and there are only a couple patterns), and overall the board just feels mushy. Id save an extra 10 bucks and go with a better board from Red Dragon or one of the well reviewed boards here on amazon.

reviewTitle: Good keyboard plagued by terrible battery life
reviewDescription: I ordered two of these, one for me and one for a friend.  We both like the keyboard and the way it feels.  The keys aren't overly tactile which I like and they are actually really quiet.  the RGB is nice to have and can be dimmed or turned off if need be.  You can use the keyboard while it's charging as well but get used to charging it because the battery only lasts 3-5 days and will die in the middle of a game or when you're typing.
Both mouse and keyboard quit working within a week. Requesting refund - not replacement. Total bummer of a product.

What's the point of the keyboard being backlit if the backlight goes out after 2 minutes of inactivity? It can't be to save battery, given that the battery is already awful, dying after two-three days of use.Got this keyboard because I'm going to be bedbound for a couple months following a major surgery, so I needed a wireless keyboard since my go-to (PICTEK RGB Gaming Keyboard) is wired and will not be able to reach the bed. Part of the appeal of this one was being able to see the keys in the dark on nights when I'm in too much pain to sleep. Problem is, the backlight goes out if you don't tap any key for 2 minutes.This might seem like a long time, but if you're watching a movie, what this means is that you end up struggling to see the keyboard any time you pause to do something else. This totally negates the point of a backlight.Also, the black paint on the keys was already flaky the moment I took it out of the box. I have had it for less a month exactly, but you can see from the pic attached that there are spots where you can see the light through breaks in the paint.The keyboard is very heavy, too, but at the same time doesn't feel very sturdy. I'm a big dropper of keyboards, and my usual is light enough that doing so really isn't a big deal, but this one feels like if I dropped it, it would break immediately, and dent the floor in the process.It's a functioning keyboard so 2 star rather than 1, but I plan to go back to my regular keyboard the second I can sit at my desk again.Oh, also! You can't make your RGB selection stick. It goes back to the default every time you turn the keyboard off and on.

Overall it seems solid, backlight is great, good adjustability and being able to set one color for entire keyboard is great. Key responsiveness  is sluggish at times, so I wouldn't recommend for gaming.The backlight timeout is super annoying and being unable to adjust or disable the timeout really drops the rating.Also this keyboard is cramped, not much better than a small laptop keyboard, which makes me think this was designed for children.This is going in the box of spare computer stuff as a backup and I'll be ordering a better keyboard.

I’ve had this keyboard for 13 months. Exactly 13 months yesterday. I do not work from this computer, nor am I a prolific gamer. There is no way I’ve come anywhere near 60 million keystrokes on ANY key of this keyboard. Not even the space bar.As you can see in the photos, these are NOT double-injection keys, which are molded with an opaque plastic shell over a clear plastic sub-layer. You literally have to wear through an entire layer of plastic to wear the letter off a double-injection key. These are quite obviously stenciled with a layer  of black paint over a clear key. Had it been advertised as such, I’d give it a higher rating, because it really is a comfortable and high-functioning keyboard.- The charge life is as advertised - I can unplug it and use it for at least a week before I need to charge it again- The keystroke is smooth and fluid- I love the color options for the lights, and my preferred setting actually changes color when my charge gets low- The size is a perfect compromise between limited desk space and ease of typing - I rarely “fat-finger” the keys like I do on laptops, but I still have plenty of space on my desk for other thingsUnfortunately, the blatant lie about the quality and manufacture of the keys has cost this product at least two stars, because I now need to replace the whole thing because of the paint wearing off.If you do decide to buy this keyboard, seal the keys with something to prolong their legibility. Make sure it’s a brush-on product that’s not too drippy, so you don’t lose key function.

Disconnects out of nowhere. Even though it is a wired keyboard. When it disconnects you have to unplug it and then plug it back in for it to register to the computer again. For the price it isn’t terrible but the disconnecting issue could cause an inconvenience.
Buttons came off during shipping only like 3 but it's not durable also bought a mouse and it's button got destroyed other than that the keyboard is nice

reviewTitle: Keyboard broke within the first 2 weeks of ownership
reviewDescription: I used this for a HTPC in a living room space. The latency and quality are all fine for the price. The onlyGripe I have is the quality of the charging port on the keyboard.I went to plug in the keyboard to charge it and the usb C charger disconnected from its board and fell into the keyboard.I opened it up and was surprised to see that the charging port had been held on by a little bit more than solder. I resoldered it and it works fine now, but the port will likely fail again as the design is not secure.

It's a lovely little keyboard with a great feel and none of that god-awful mechanical keyboard clacking.  Unfortunately, its anti-ghosting process is misguided, and there are no dedicated macro keys.If you don't know what "anti-ghosting" is: properly done it allows you to hit multiple keys at the same time.  When using WASD controls, if you want to move diagonally you press two keys at once ("W" and "D," perhaps) and they both work.  With some ancient keyboards, if you pressed multiple keys at once, only one or two would actually get passed from the keyboard to your PC.  The anti-ghosting on this board works most of the time, but there are a few common key combinations that simply don't work.  The one that bothered me most was that Ctl-Shift-Esc would not bring up the Task Manager, which should always work on Windows.  A Windows application hangs and you can't shut it down the way you normally would -- that's not a good look.It's a keyboard that fails at just being a basic keyboard, at times.

reviewTitle: Great keyboard, misleading description. It's wireless only
reviewDescription: The wireless K11 is an excellent keyboard and I would give it 4 or 5 stars but I'm returning it because of the misleading product description. I wanted a keyboard that is plugged in most of the time but can be disconnected and used wirelessly when needed. The description says, "Two working modes, wired and wireless, enjoy the freedom of being wireless while still not compromising performance by going wired".There is only ONE working mode: wireless. There is no "wired" mode. The wireless USB receiver (dongle) has to be plugged in at all times. But you can still use the keyboard while it's charging. Keyboard data isn't sent over the USB cable. It's only transmitted wirelessly to the USB receiver. The problem with this is that you have to use two USB ports if you want to use it in the so-called "wired" mode which isn't actually a wired mode. It's just a "you can still use it while charging" mode. My mouse takes up a third USB port. Now I have to buy a USB hub for the three ports for the keyboard and mouse.Here's a suggestion: include two USB-A ports on either side of the keyboard to connect a mouse for left- or right-handed users so the keyboard and mouse only use one USB port on my computer.By the way, Chinese businesses, would it be so hard to contract an actual native English speaker to write your product description? Someone who can accurately describe your product in real English? The products are often great but the descriptions range from funny to maddening, especially if you have to return the product because it isn't what was described.

reviewTitle: Great idea, not too good on the quality
reviewDescription: I purchased this keyboard almost a year ago.Not for gaming. I wake up at night and often hit the computer. I am not a touch typist and I look at the keys to keep my fingers in the correct spots, it is too dim to see the keys without turning on lots of lights. My last couple of laptops had backlit keyboards so I thought a desktop backlit keyboard would be my salvationAt first I was thrilled, it worked great.However in about four+ months time, the "a" key started to lose it's paint. Based on how I use my fingers to type, I blamed myself at first. As time went on more keys started showing paint loss and I ralised I was not the problem. You can see the worst of it in the photos taken tonightI am at the point where I now want to replace this keyboard.Over the decades I almost never felt that I needed to replace a desktop's keyboard even after many years of use.  To  feel that I need to replace one after only a handful of months is not an acceptable product lifespanIs this keyboard worth the money? Not in my mind.

reviewTitle: Very cheaply painted and loud, but sturdy and will probably last a long time for typing.
reviewDescription: I wouldn't call this a gaming keyboard, the only "gaming" thing about really it is the LED backlight. But as far as mechanical keyboards go, it's okay. Very study physically, it has some weight and heft to it and the rubber feet stick to a desk pretty well.This keyboard is not quiet, much less silent. It's a very average and therefore loud keyboard.My only complaint, as you can see in the photo, is the black paint used to cover the keys (and keyboard face underneath that) is way too thin. All the little colored specks on the shift/control/space bar/and other keys, those are where the black paint has worn off from normal usage on frequently touched keys, allowing light from the LEDs to shine through. This is usage from April 2021 to April 2022, so about one year.Super easy to clean. The little red tool they give you for "picking" the keys off works well for removing them. I do fear though that using it more than a few times is going to scrape that super thin black paint off the sides of the keys and let light through, just as you can see happens from one year of regular typing.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: It's a cheap keyboard, but not a particularly good keyboard. The right shift button often doesn't register button presses. Can't wait for this to break so I can justify a new keyboard purchase.
Purchased for my backyard bar. I am 6 feet from the computer and the signal won't reach. If I stand next to the computer <2ft, the signal reaches just fine.

I bought this to use at work, so I can’t say how it treats gamers, but here’s my experience:This was awesome at first. Lovely lighting, good sounding clicks, wireless worked great, got compliments from my coworkers, and it would need a charge every other day or so. (The cable is a charging cable, not a way to connect to a computer. Wireless USB plug only)The only complaint I had at first was that the keys weren’t very responsive. I type 60 wpm, and I kept finding missing letters in my typing, especially double letters. But I thought maybe my typing might be part of the problem too.But then after three months of use (just typing, no gaming, nothing too strenuous) it started breaking down.Keys were starting to fade away, the keyboard would glitch and shut off for a second even on full charge, even while on the charger. The keys were getting way less responsive too, so mistakes were popping up in my typing constantly.I had to ditch this and get different keyboard.Considering the price I paid, not terribly upset, just disappointed that it’s only been 3 months and it’s already giving out on me.I’d recommend this to the occasional user. Anyone looking to use this constantly, don’t. Not unless you’re okay with replacing it real soon.

reviewTitle: Does not maintain power from USB port.
reviewDescription: I have a brand new home built computer & the keyboard turns on and off throughout the day and its use.  Seems like the USB is not connecting well.  It's very frustrating as I did not realize this soon enough to make the return.  I'll continue to troubleshoot what I can.

reviewTitle: Will not stay lit - Light s timeout
reviewDescription: What in the world were they thinking? Keyboard lights time out if not used?  So it is a backlit keyboard that times out.  If you get up to get coffee you come back to a blacked out keyboard. Not good!

My biggest gripe with this keyboard is that after only 6 months of use there are multiple keys where the paint has completely worn off. Second is that the lighting on the 10-key pad is poor and only lights up the bottom half of the numbers. As someone who is apparently incapable of developing the hand-eye coordination to type completely without looking and frequently needs to check my position this is really annoying. The battery life is decent for this type of keyboard I suppose, but the LED color resets back to the garish red/blue/green every time the battery dies which it always does at the most inconvenient time. It would be nice if there was a low battery indicator so I could charge it overnight and not have to pull out the cord in the middle of a sentence. A white light option would also be nice, I only bought this because it was the only wireless keyboard I could find that wasn't those wafer-thin ones with the flat keys and I don't particularly want the rainbow colors.

reviewTitle: Ok for light use, not great for Home Office.
reviewDescription: I have been searching for a "work from home" keyboard not over the top expense wise that holds up to normal wear and tear. On cheap keyboards with painted lettering I wear the letters off the common keys in about 6-8 months and this was described that the keys would not wear.  Unfortunately in about 2 weeks I already saw signs of wear and about a month in I had sections of the key paint missing (letters are not painted, but the keys themselves are, its not actually the plastic that's colored).  I could have dealt with that for a while since it was wireless and otherwise was working, except that shortly after I began having connectivity issues.  Initially when I'd start a sentence, the first letter wouldn't type, then it increased to every fifth or so word was "missing" a letter as it was not transmitting every key stroke.  Ultimately now its sitting under my desk as an emergency backup and I'm back to a cheaper keyboard that I set aside previously (minus the paint on it's keys) and I'm back to searching for something that's not a full blown gaming keyboard that costs five times as much.  While it worked it WAS a good keyboard but I work in IT so I can't have accounts locking due to mistyped passwords when the keyboard decides which letters to send.
background colors make hard to see letter's on keyboard....as an old hunt and peck user....very hard to see ....i do like the feature it shuts it's self off after no use

Wife works on line, she says it has a better feel and better response than her previous wireless keyboard. Colored leds on the keys just makes it eye candy. She is really pleased with this keyboard. If she likes it, then I love it.Update: Stopped Working just under 90days. Was Not used for gaming so shoulda lasted a couple years at least (my thought).

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
reviewDescription: Keyboard works fine for what it is. After a couple of minutes, the keyboard goes dark. You have to hit a random key to get the lights back on so you can see what you're doing. Be nice if there was a way to keep them on.
Keyboard was shipped without instructions. Would love to know how to make the keyboard lighting stay on ALL the time, but this information for this specific model is available NOWHERE on line.

reviewTitle: Looks great, but horrible wireless penetration
reviewDescription: I have the older black model K11 unit. I like the functionality, look and feel of this keyboard, but the wireless signal penetration is absolutely horrible! I bout this to use while Playing an MMORPG on my PS4 from the couch in the living room. If there is absolutely anything between the keyboard and the USB receiver, the signal is blocked. And I mean anything, a person, an object, your own knee or feet (while sitting reclined)... Is this thing actually wireless, or just infrared, like old TV remotes? It was driving me nuts trying to figure out why it wouldn't work, until I figured out the problem.I'm sorry that it took me so long to use it that I'm not likely to be able to do anything about it. I'll reach out to their support and see if there's anything they can do, but I've already seen one review saying that they stopped responding after a single email. /FingersCrossed

At least it looks nice and 'spiffy' on my desk.  It also uses metal and has some bulk to it which feels nice while typing.There are 2 main problems.The first is that it only has 3 preset LED settings.  You can't change that at all, so hope you like the presets!The second issue is what made me return one keyboard, and finally decide to write a review.The key finishes wear down WAY too fast, like in days, not months.  I had to return the first keyboard after a few weeks because the major keys A,S,D,W,E etc, were already at the point where half the paint had worn off of the keys.  Even the paint on my cheap $5 keyboards lasted over a year before they got to this point.My 2nd keyboard is already starting to show signs of the keys wearing away, so it apparently wasn't a flaw with my original keyboard, sigh.I'm probably going to keep the keyboard since I like the weight and feel, and can touch type (thankfully).  However, I can't give this more than a 3 star review.

reviewTitle: Illuminated keys but not as bright as desired
reviewDescription: Keys are okay but varying color lights are not as bright as I would like

The keyboard functioned nicely while you're typing on it, but after 5 minutes of no activitythe lights shut off, and you have to re awaken it by typing again. This may not bother some people, but I like the lights to stay on as long as the computer is on. Just a heads up!

Another "great at first" item. It worked like a charm for about 2 months then I had to start charging it more and more often.  Then I couldn't change the lights or make them scroll. Like I said, another "great at first" item.

reviewTitle: Not bad for price, but flawed
reviewDescription: The keyboard works pretty well, but durability is being called into question. I bought this specifically because on my old Dell keyboard the letters were rubbing off, and this said they were laser engraved, so I figured that wouldn’t be a problem. Well, a few weeks of use, and the letter A is a lighted blob. The black of the key is rubbing off. No better than the Dell, except the Dell with the cheap printed keys lasted a year before rubbing off, not a few weeks. And, instead of sending a replacement key, their remedy is mail the whole thing back, and wait for repairs. So I would have to buy a replacement to use while waiting for it to ship out, repair, and return ship. Might as well throw it away and just buy a better one.

reviewTitle: "The colors suck," says the wife. Replaced with Pictek keyboard (Which Azn quit selling.)
reviewDescription: This was to be a backlit keyboard for my wife's new PC.  I have been thrilled with my PICTEK keyboard.  It is flexible as to color choices, color positioning, and brightness.  Unfortunately, that wasn't available.  This one, in the same price range, looked similar, but (unless I simply can't get it working) the colors are less visible through the keys and are not changeable, such as to all blue.  She hates their choice of color-positioning.

reviewTitle: had one thats worked for a year another broke after a few months
reviewDescription: overall decentI bought it because I spilled a drink on an expensive keyboard ruining itwhile I lived somewhere that was likely to happen again I used cheap keyboardsI think i'll move back to something a bit nicer.

reviewTitle: Well, it was nice while it lasted
reviewDescription: I got this to replace the wire logitech keyboard I had in my office in an attempt to rid myself of unnecessary cables.So far, it's been great. The keyboard itself feels sturdy and has a good weight to it. The keys aren't obnoxiously loud and don't lag when pressed. I love the fact that I can change the light patterns and brightness, and have it shut off when not in immediate use.I've used it all week this week for about 8ish hours a day without issue or needing to recharge.Overall, it's a great keyboard for my office work and the lights add a little *extra*.Edit: It now no longer holds a charge. I can literally leave it plugged in for over a day, and it won't turn on. If, in the rare event it does turn on, it doesn't even last a day. I'm really disappointed, because I loved it.

reviewTitle: Battery doesn't last and Keyboard lags
reviewDescription: The keyboard looks just like the description. The colored lights on it are very bright and vibrate and easy to see even in full daylight. However, I find if I'm typing on it (to send an email, etc) I notice the keyboard will miss a couple of keys that I know I hit (not typos), almost as if I was typing too fast for it to process every keystroke I made. I don't think I type that fast and have never had this issue with other keyboards. The battery also dies very quickly. Doesn't last for more than a day or two before I have to plug it in to re-charge, which defeats the purpose of making it wireless if I'm constantly having to use it plugged in. Overall, I think it's a bit pricey for what you get. If you're just looking for the aesthetics, this is it, but if you're looking for a solid keyboard that doesn't need a lot of attention...this isn't it.

The keyboards works well enough for gaming and programming. It is not too noisy but is not absolutely silent.Nevertheless, this product has some issues:- backlight bright is decreasing from center to borders.- It lacks from white light- The keys are of bad quality. I have a couple of keys blurred  (A, left Ctrl and Spacebar) only with 4 months of use, when cheaper keyboards last even years without evident blurring in most used keys.- Ctrl keys somethings are not responsive.I think there are better membrane keyboards to choose.

reviewTitle: Like one style, 2cd order style not so much.
reviewDescription: The color options are limited to just a few.  The Keyboard is always 3 colors you cant change it to any one single color at a time.  But it does have some options for brightness and fading in and out.  I do like the feel of it, nice mechanical sound with large keys.  I also like that the keys sit up off the board instead of sunk into a shroud like case, this makes it easy to keep crumbs and stuff out cause we all know we munch on stuff while gaming.Overall it looks good, works well and is easy to clean.**update*I bought a second keyboard from this company and found the reviews are not seperate from one style to another.  I bought the larger style with mouse this time around and it is not as good as I hoped, the keyboard doesn't stay lit up all the time but the mouse does, it type nice bice but the wrist rest area is a little large and not soft at all, overall its ok.I am removing a star for not being able to review the items seperately because the styles alone function differently they need seperate review catagories.

The keyboard is of decent quality and it works almost as promised. While the chroma colours are very limited, the keys mostly light up enough to see what the letters say.Be aware though, if you're looking to both play games and write on this keyboard, that I would NOT recommend it for everyday writing. While the response time on the individual keys is great and barely felt--if at all--it is not always when writing that the keys register you having pressed the key, and sometimes you either have to press the same key multiple times or press down on it harder than should be necessary.You will play games with speed and reliability, but prepare yourself to also be writing with no small amount of typos.

reviewTitle: This is quality reflective of the price, but a decent deal for the cost
reviewDescription: So. The important thing to remember here is the price. This was 15-20 dollars depending on when you got it with Black Friday. It is however, very cheaply made. For the price it’s actually pretty decent when I think about it. The black coating on the keys wears off easily and the larger keys (space bar, enter, etc) have springs or something under them that squeak horribly. The rest of the keys make the nice satisfying click noise. But I generally find this to be disappointing. I will send it back when it stops working completely but for now need it for work from home. The lights do work well and it functions great. Maybe good for kids!!!! UPDATE: on my lunch break i took out the keys that had the wire stabilizers under them. The squeak is gone and everything functions just fine. The black coating is wearing off still but it’s useable. For the price it’s fun and the key’s make that click sound you are looking for.
Unless you hold the keyboard in the right positions you can't see the letters or numbers. Its well-built, the only problems its being dark keys before typing.

reviewTitle: Good keyboard but came a little damaged
reviewDescription: The keyboard works well and fits comfortably. However the sticker that goes over the lock key lights does not stick down and is scratched.

I enjoy this keyboard.  It functions great in all the critical ways. I'm using it to connect to my tablet that is connected to my 65" TV 5m away and I've never had a problem.  There are only 1 issues consider if purchasing.  The paint/coating on the keys isn't very durable.  After playing my favorite game, which uses the  WASD keys for movement, maybe 20 hrs the S keys coating started to wear off.  After 40ish hours the D key shows the same.  This is not really a issue for me as I'm a touch typist, but it might be a concern for others.  To be fair, in the game I'm playing, I probably pressed these keys equivalent to 1000+ hrs of normal non-game usage. This has happened to other keyboards I've used but only after hundreds of hours of game play. (Updated 2/6/22) Keys have stopped working consistently, not great when in a battle. Loses a star for lasting only 7 months.

reviewTitle: Not a bad basic keyboard but.......
reviewDescription: After using this product for about 2 months I can give it an honest review. Kinda a flim flammy board with nice clicky noises. I use this keyboard almost daily for work and gaming. Sometimes key punches don't register and two keys have already went dead. The rgb is quite basic to put it politely. I wouldn't recommend this keyboard for competitive gaming just due to the fact that there is major key lag and it doesn't always register input. I would buy this keyboard for my kids to play Minecraft but it falls short in any competitive games. Nothing like being the last alive in Warzone and now your movement keys are useless. Very poor Bluetooth connection even though mine is always plugged into the MOBO directly.

You might think this would be great for the price, but it's not, when you have to buy a new one every six months, because that's about how long they last.The keyboard is mostly hanging on, a couple keys are starting to give out, which I can deal with.The mouse makes me angry. Yes, I always keep it adequately charged. In fact, I can hardly ever unplug because it seems to have the lifespan of a jug of milk left out of the fridge. If you're actually using this for gaming I pity you.A few weeks ago the cursor lost less than half of its sensitivity. No big deal, I just turned the sensitivity up to max and it was fine.Just now it completely gave up, the cursor will not move, only click.Meanwhile, my eight dollar, three year old logitech mouse is working perfectly, in fact I had to turn the sensitivity way back down (you shouldn't need the sensitivity to be turned to max for adequate function anyway,) so I think I'm just gonna keep using that.Once this keyboard dies in, I estimate, a couple months, I'm definitely not going to buy it again.

reviewTitle: Keyboard feels fine, key conflicts make the keyboard unusable for my needs
reviewDescription: TLDR: Can't press control+shift+enter, control+shift+P, control+shift+K, or control+shift+U at the same time. Can't press right+up+O, right+up+N, or right+up+P at the same time and many other 3 key conflicts. Otherwise the keyboard is pretty nice for the price.I just picked up this keyboard as a replacement to my last keyboard that broke during a move. This keyboard looked nice and small, there's no large useless plastics like my last keyboard, the keys are a lot quieter than my last keyboard, print screen is a dedicated key, overall I liked the keyboard and felt like it was an upgrade from the one I had before.The downside is that it has major problems with registering multiple keys being pressed at the same time. I haven't had any 2 key problems but the minute I try and press 3 keys at once there are bunch of conflicts all over the place that cause major problems. The biggest one that makes the keyboard useless to me is control+shift+enter. The text editor I use has a lot of functionality bound to control+shift+... and I use control+shift+enter constantly. I also found that I couldn't jump or dash while moving down+right in a multiplayer game that has jump mapped to comma and dash mapped to period (weird mapping but it was so you could play 2 players on 1 keyboard easier). You also can't press N while holding down right. You can't press O, P, N, comma, or period while holding up+right. You can't press Y, O, or P while holding up+left. You can't press Y, left bracket, or right bracket while holding down+left. You can't press control+alt+shift+U,K, or P at the same time.I've had keyboard that have key conflicts before but I've never had any combinations that actual cause problems during normal usage. Obviously this conflicts probably won't cause problems if all you do is write documents or browse the web but if you are playing a game that uses the arrow keys it's not uncommon that you might need to move in two directions at once and use a third letter key to perform an action. In my mind this keyboard has no place calling itself a gaming keyboard with conflicts like that. In my case, I am a programmer who uses a bunch of long hotkeys in a text editor so anything that restricts any combination of control/shift/alt and any letter key is a no-go for me.

reviewTitle: POS especially for gaming. Wireless range is about 2 ft
reviewDescription: Do not buy this garbage. I've used it for 30mins so far and after charging for 5hrs it just connects and disconnects on and off. Also the lag on the mouse is horrible and frequently needs to be shaken to start working again. If you are a gamer DO NOT GET THIS . The biggest and WORST feature of this thing is the range. It literally will not work without cutting in and out unless you are less than 2 ft away so when I try and hook up my computer to my TV and use it while sitting on the couch it won't work.

Ever since I received it, the mouse would cut off and lag. The amount of games I’ve lost trying to use that mouse is insane. There is way too much latency and it glitches so much. It’s almost like your entire computer is lagging but no it’s just these two terrible devices lagging and not accepting any kind of input for minutes at a time. I find that the only way the mouse works is if you press real hard on the surface you’re using. The keyboard shuts off randomly while you’re using it, I find myself having to turn it off and on before it shuts off on its own 5 minutes later (I know it’s not the battery being low because that happens when it’s plugged in, when it’s full battery, and when it’s low battery) overall a frustrating product and I promise you it’s not worth going for the cheap one.

reviewTitle: Looks and Feels good but doesnt reliably work
reviewDescription: The keyboard itself feels really solid and typing is great. Mouse is a little lighter than I like, but overall the build quality or how it feels is solid. Battery life is also great.However, this product falls apart in performance. After a month or so of owning the product the keyboard is randomly losing connection with the PC or Steam deck. There are times when attempting to play a game (Battlefield 2042, World of Warships or Warthunder) where the keyboard noticeably drops. The mouse has similar issues as wellThis isn't an issue with the battery it is not charging when being plugged in. It isn't an issue with USB port as I have tried different USB ports on my PC and on the Steam Deck dock. This issue does occur with my old Logitech K270 using those same portsWhile the way the keyboard types, the battery life and the look of the product is solid the fact the product cant reliable works bring this a 1 star product. I am unsure if this is just a defective product but its disappointing to me.

Initially, this was an awesome keyboard. The key feel is amazing. And the coloured lights are useless but kind of interesting.However, one reason I bought this keyboard was its claim (that you can see right in the product description) that "the characters never fade".Well, this is an outright lie. I received my keyboard on May 27th. Yes, I use it extensively; and the picture accompanying this review was taken on June 7. You can see the N key is already going fast and there is growing wear on the A, S, and D keys (all of which are used extensively in gaming). That's less than two weeks for those of you who are counting. Two weeks is a long way from never...don't you think?The only reason I am giving it 2 stars is because most other keyboards under $100 also fade very quickly, so this is not worse than the others, but it is also definitely no better. Other than the ensuing and inevitable fading of the key characters, the feel is still really nice.UPDATE: Reverted to 1 star. DO NOT BUY THIS KEYBOARD! I have attached an updated picture with keyboard wear for exactly 1 month of daily use. In addition , the keys sometimes go crazy and start repeating. In one case, with no keys depressed at all, the keyboard started inputting infinite space characters into my documents until I unplugged it and re-plugged the USB cable. Also, the "W" key seems to double for a left and right arrow key, which makes playing a game like Minecraft impossible, since, as you move forward, you will switch items in hand (beating on a creeper with a map is not a good idea!).I have now ordered a new Dell keyboard. The feel won't be as nice, but at least I can read the keys and won't be subject to this much bugginess.

reviewTitle: I really wanted to like this, but it has one big fault.
reviewDescription: The pros:The keyboard itself looks amazing. For the price, there aren’t many RGB keyboards around this range. It’s also in a metal frame, I personally like the added weight, and it makes it more solid and feels more secure.The one amazing feature is that the cord is braided! (Something that other companies like Corsair or razer don’t do for their cheaper keyboards).The cons:Typing would be good enough, if it wasn’t for the space bar not always working as intended. A good 60-70% of the times I pressed the space bar whilst typing it wasn’t registered(?) it made the sound, but it didn’t always work, unless I pushed harder than what do with my thumb, I almost always ended up going back and having to separate words whenever this happened, I ended up wasting about as long as it took to type, if not longer, correcting the spacing errors.I even gave it a about 2 weeks, thinking it might be due to the keyboard being new, hoping it would adjust. I also checked if the space bar was loose, and tried to secure it, but sadly that wasn’t the case.The other issue, but this is a minor one, is the fact that the keys are wobbly, and I think the layout of the keyboard, plus the keys being wobbly make it so that you sometimes press the wrong letter when typing. This didn’t happen as a often, and for the price this keyboard costs (17.09$ at the time I bought it) , I could live with it.In the end, you get what you pay for. If it wasn’t for the space bar being faulty, I would like this keyboard, it looks nice thanks to the RGB, it has a braided cord, but when it comes to its primary function, it fails.I wouldn't recommend buying this keyboard if you’re going to use it for typing (it’s the main function, I know…) but if you’re ONLY going to use it for playing games that DON’T require typing, then this is good, I played  Skyrim & Fallout and it worked just fine.I already returned the keyboard and ordered a (hopefully) higher quality one, it’s the Corsair k55.

I've been plagued by poor keyboard connectivity and battery life issues since it arrived. I had to buy a new charging cable for my "wireless" keyboard so I can use it at all and still have connectivity problems. The mouse worked great until 10 days after the Amazon returns window closed. It turned off in the middle of a game and never charged again. I'm snowed in and stuck with a $40 pile of trash and no way to play games. Wish I returned it earlier when I noticed the first problem

reviewTitle: Keyboard Look/Feel awesome; but it frequently resets only after 1 month of use.
reviewDescription: The first three weeks I used this keyboard I had no problems.  In the past week, however, it has increasingly been misbehaving while typing large amounts of text.  I will e(1)(2)xplain.(3)  (When you see a number(4) in parentheses, the issue occurred)As you type, at some point in the middle of a sentence or thought (5), the keyboard stops responding to input, the key backlight flashes, the lights go out, and then they come back on, as if the keyboard is resetting.  If you're unlucky enough to have this happen at the exact moment a key was pressed, you will get that key repeated between 40 and 60 times in a row(6), but it will lose all the text you were t(7)yp(8)ing.  Usually it happens a couple times in a row, so after it ha(9)ppensssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss(10,11,12,13,14,15,16) once, it continues to happen.(17).  I(18)t is frustrating and, since I use this keyboard for work and on my personal machine, I am finding it very dddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd(18)ifficult to actually do my job.I will be switching keyboards back to an old oooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo(19)ne I have lying around until I can either process the return OR the vendor contacts me.The price was great and the performance was awesome until these keyboard mishaps starting showing up.  So much so that I recommended it to friends, one of whom purchased it and has not been seeing these issues.I hope it's just a bad keyboard and not a design flaw.  If I can capture it happening on video, I will post that here as well.As you can see, it reset 19 times while typing this review.  It actually reset more, but I lost count while trying to type "(10)" - that was a real mess.EDIT: Later the day of the above review:  I realized that my window to return this keyboard expired 2 days ago.  Guess I'm stuck with it.  Sadly will have to pay to recycle it.

reviewTitle: Input Delay keeps the keyboard away.
reviewDescription: I rarely leave any reviews, especially negatives ones, but I must warn you about this keyboard.  It's not good.  I bought this keyboard with already low expectations, I only needed it for a week away from home and I needed a wireless keyboard But I wanted one with a USB transmitter and not Bluetooth.  I also needed a keyboard with number pad and mechanical.  So this seemed like a cheap, quick buy to serve a one time purpose.It's only a few days after using it and pretty much out of the gate I noticed this keyboard has absolutely poor input delay.  I'f you type fast there is an incredibly high chance that your words will be missing letters.  It also randomly will take a random key you pressed and input it randomly over and over for no reason what so ever.Even from the aspect of being mechanical, it's very poor.  Also the RGB lights arnt even one single static color.  They give you several different lighting options and configuration, but they can't give you the most basic function of a single static color?  That's bare minimum in my book.I won't be using this keyboard long enough to encounter the other issue that almost everyone encounters, the paint on the keys will fade.  And apparently this happens rather quickly.  So also take that into consideration.So here's my point, you here because you are obviously looking for cheap, wireless keyboard, maybe with with RGB and maybe you want it mechanical, and in here to tell you that there are Def some good options out there for $20-30.  But I'm here to tell you that this one is not it.  Keep looking.

I want to like this keyboard but I really can't ...pros:-solid construction through and through-win 10 compatible in every waycons:-only one (1) FN key awkwardly placed on the bottom right of keyboard which makes it frustrating to use since you have to constantly use it for a great many things in order for this keyboard to achieve its full potential including volume control-the LED backlight is limited to a multi color option only which makes certain parts of the keyboard dark and a strain on the eyes - no single color option available on this keyboard (e.g. white, blue, yellow) and the color combinations, while cool, are useless-biggest deal breaker is this keyboard lacks any "legs" on the base so you can't angle it to any comfortable typing position - really hard to understand why this would be a lacking feature which has been basic to 99.999 of keyboards manufactured in last 20 yearsoverall a bust and probably a return - it's a gadget but not a useful addition to my rig

I received this keyboard and tested out the basic keys that I use often.  I was pleased with the look and feel and immediately packed it up to take to the office.  As soon as I started to work I noticed that the Alt keys were not working.  Upon further review some of the other keys were not working either.  I was planning to return this item and repurchase, but the coupon I original used is no longer available.  Unsure if I will repurchase or not.Update:  After returning this item the seller reached out and was able to offer me the same coupon discount.  I've purchased the keyboard again and all keys are working.  Hopefully there aren't any issues in the future, but so far so good.update 2 - several keys are now not working on the keyboard after one week [shift key plus others].  this has been mentioned by several others.  good customer service through this company, but not a quality product.  i would not recommend this keyboard.

All I wanted was a simple keyboard that has a backlight so I can see the keyboard in the dark.  This keyboard was absolutely perfect until I noticed that the backlight automatically cuts off after so much time of inactivity.  I cant find a way to disable this.  I just need a backlight that is always on.

reviewTitle: Paint wore off a good number of keys in a few months time.
reviewDescription: I was looking for a decent keyboard for the price that would have some longevity.  I didn't really care about the backlit keys or gaming.  The keys wearing off in a few months time and being unidentifiable glowing blobs has been disappointing.  I ordered a replacement keyboard from a different manufacturer on Prime Day.  Buyer beware on this one.
Once initial charge was used, keyboard no longer worked. Unable to hold charge. Tested with multiple charges, outlets, and PCs. Waste of money.

I bought this keyboard a couple years ago and around Christmas 2021 it started doing double keys. Random, but M and D a lot. So, research showing that there's most likely a chip in it that causes that after a while. The F, M and S just did that while I'm typing this. So, I like it and order another one to replace it. I'm lazy and just got around to switching them today. New one's lights come on but the computer doesn't see it - no key presses, can't turn on Caps or Num locks. Garbage. But the real Rip Off comes when I try to return it to learn my "return window" closed last month. DO NOT RECOMMEND!

The shift keys on this keyboard did not work from the moment I charged it. Went through the troubleshooting guide on Amazon and still did not work. Have reached out to the company and will update my review if they resolve the issue.

I was SUPER excited to buy this! I've always wanted one. Did my research for the best one I could afford. I chose this one. It worked great...for a few months. Now? It barely holds a charge. And of course it happened after my the return policy was up. I can charge it all I want it only lasts for about 10 minutes if I'm lucky. It's a waste of money and I'm so disappointed. I don't have the money for another one and now I'm stuck with something that doesn't effing work😔

I bought this to replace my previous logitech keyboard when it started spamming the z key. I was super excited when it arrived. The keys felt great, nice response, super clicky which was nice. The lights were bright and pretty and even though I kind of didn't like that it would go to sleep every few seconds I didn't really mind. Then four days in it just shut off...ok batteries dead that's fine I can just plug it in right? Nope it's dead unresponsive, Maybe it's the cord...nope, nothing. The little red light doesn't even show it's receiving a charge. After fiddling with it for twenty minutes I finally got it to light up...ok maybe it's user error, I'll give it another shot...nope ten seconds in it shuts down again and is dead...I'm returning it feeling very sad and using an old plug in keyboard I luckily had in my closet..I wanted to give a good review...sadly I have to say DO NOT BUY (T^T)
Lights stop working after 3 months. Went through all troubleshooting steps and still no luck.

reviewTitle: Battery won’t last and loses connection
reviewDescription: Got this keyboard around 2 weeks ago. Keepboard and mouse are nice feeling and durable, but unit can’t keep a charge for anything. I have tried multiple different ways to charge it, light keeps shutting off after a couple minutes of being plugged in. Also unit keeps losing connection to the usb and I have tried all kinds of ports to make sure it wasn’t anything on my end. Definitely returning this device.
Quit charging after 90 days. Stuck with defective product now. Look elsewhere

Worked but after a couple of months the legends on the keys started to disappear. Then it just stopped working except the lights would flash on and off once when you switched it on. Then nothing. Tried it on a different computer nothing. Battery fully charged.  No response from the company despite several attempted email contacts. Guess once they have your money they don't really care. Don't waste your money.
The mouse stopped working in less than 3 months. Under product support there isn't a driver to update for this model. Tried contacting the seller from their website no response.

I bought this keyboard in Apr 2022 and I was initially satisfied with the item: I needed it for my home office because the keys on my laptop were not backlit and I could not see the letters well. I haven't had the keyboard for even a year before it stopped working completely. It randomly stopped working in the middle of my shift. I charged it for several hours to see if that would help and it did not. Finally I reached out the seller who promises a two year warranty. They answered my email with information not related to what I asked. I responded back, again, asking for the best way to file a claim to get an item replacement---as they advertised. No response. I'm not sure if I am the only person who received a faulty or defective keyboard but I would recommend a different seller: not because the item stopped working but because the seller refused to honor the warranty THEY advertised and promoted. Now I am out of the money for the keyboard and the keyboard itself.

Stopped functioning after 1 month and 3 days.  This is the same as the experience ofAmanda Millerhttps://www.amazon.com/gp/profile/amzn1.account.AHYRYCVPREL6CWJVKUNI63IBVTDQ/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_pdp?ie=UTF8J.S.Spencehttps://www.amazon.com/gp/profile/amzn1.account.AFRQHCPK4TP7CKDVVRWR524DVW3Q/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_pdp?ie=UTF8Døn Diego dela Vegaonhttps://www.amazon.com/gp/profile/amzn1.account.AE3LLNVB2BQNZM5EVN4NMFETFS7A/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_pdp?ie=UTF8==========================================="4 times/seconds touching without defective" That's in the instructions.  Checking other European languages that should be "defect" or "defects". I still have no guess what it means.There is a little red plastic ring that fell out of the packing. It's about 1 inch wide with 2 prongs that are meant to attach to something.  I don't see any function for it.It is a sunny afternoon and I am sitting by the white curtains of the west window. The LEDs are clearly bright enough.The keyboard sits too flat. That, and the sensitivity of the key means I accidentally sometimes get a CTRL key.  Those keys should have been made lower than the others.  I will glue on some rubber erasers as feet or maybe a piece of wood to correct the angle.  A couple erasers have solved the problem for now.It is breathing -- green-blue-red, blue-red-green cyan-magenta-yellow.  The instructions on how to change the speed don't work.  The novelty of the breathing mode will wear off anyway.The USB cable is not coated in vinyl but with a braided cloth.  I have no reason to think it will be any better, but it is classy.
Keyboard and mouse bundle arrived on time. It was easy to install and use. It stopped working and charging after 2 months. Reliability is an issue.
Product defective, obvious manufacturers defect on cord, won't work on 3 different computers

My purchase was in 2020The colors/brightness are very good, and the keyboard continues to work great.TLDR: Keycaps are not double shot, but painted and paint wears away.My gripe is that they keys are not double shot, and that the keys are painted. The lettering may be laser engraved, but after 3 years the paint is wearing away in multiple spots (especially on WASD). I attempted to use adhesive protectors to slow the degradation but those are a short term fix.Furthermore, as it is a membrane type keyboard, replacement keycaps are not available.

reviewTitle: If I could give 0 stars, I would...
reviewDescription: What a waste of money. The first set I received came with a broken mouse. The second (replacement) set I received dies constantly. The keyboard essentially needs to be left on the charger or it will just die or malfunction somehow. Both the keyboard and mouse constantly delay. I've never experienced this with other brands. Terrible quality, terrible performance. Buying ANOTHER set, because this isn't sustainable and I work from home, but it certainly won't be from this company. Don't waste your money or time. I wish I hadn't.
Bad brand. Brand new, some of the keys don't work.

I purchased the product to be able to the keys while in a dark lit room. In the pictures they have,  you are able to see the light through the keys but the product I received are just regular keys with led underneath which essentially defeats the purpose of the keyboard for me. Very disappointed the product wasn't as advertised

Hi, so I'm a new gamer and I was looking for a dope new keyboard for cheap, and I ended up coming across this thing. I ordered it and it arrived decently, the box wasn't damaged or anything.Mind you, I ordered a new, and not used product, hoping for it to be in pristine condition but I was brutally let down by the seller. The thing which plugs into the computer was rusty and so I took some isopropyl and a Q tip to attempt to clean my "brand new" keyboard. It plugged in fine but then a day later my computer would start bugging out, so I switched to the other keyboard I had and lone behold it worked just fine.I later on checked and the time frame for returns was closed. So now I'm here with a faulty keyboard and 21.99 US dollars short.:(

reviewTitle: Pretty but don’t waste your money
reviewDescription: This thing is absolute trash. It doesn’t stay charged very long (I can usually make it to lunch before it dies), so I’ve had to keep it plugged in 24/7. Additionally, it’s so poorly made, the keys often don’t work. It is very frustrating to constantly have to backtrack to make corrections. I guess it’s fine if you don’t know how to type, but as a busy professional, this keyboard reduces my productivity greatly. I bought one for a friend at the same time, and she also hates it. I’ll be throwing this in the garbage where it belongs.

reviewTitle: Black layer is peeling off the keys - cheaply made
reviewDescription: As you'll see in the photo, on the "N" key (and various other keys as time goes on), the black paint or whatever the keys are coated with, is peeling off. I've only had this since the week after Christmas, and it is now early May, so I am  disappointed with this product. If I could buy it again, I would not. I'd choose a different one. This is one is pretty cheaply made, and not what I'd consider a quality item, or an item that will last longer than say, a year. The keys are pretty when lit, and the keyboard is easy to use, but the wearing off of the letters on the keys is an issue. It is also a bit louder than a regular keyboard when typing, so be aware. I knew it would be, but without it being a true mechanical keyboard, I was surprised by just how loud it actually was.

Bought as a cute pick me up for my home office.3 different preset rainbow style backlights. Different styles can be switched between by a clearly marked button on the keyboard. The backlight can also be brightened, lowered or turned off completely.  Keyboard has a nice cloth wrapped cord. Very compact design for a small desktop.All that said SAVE YOUR MONEY! This is a CHEAP clickily click clap click keyboard. Not soft very loud. After ONE day of use the M & K keys have decided they are MARRIED! So, if I use one I am sure to get the other. Makes for a great day with spell check. I have decided to use my laptop to write this review.I really wanted it to work because it's cute, but with the glitch in the key this is a CHEAP MISS.
Bargain RGB keyboard; you get what you pay for. Inexplicably ceased to function after less than 1 year of ownership with very light use. (Wife's PC, she barely uses it.)
This is the worst purchase i have ever made.  This was supposed to be a simple keyboard, but it is difficult to use, and it reverts to no useable conditions after each hour off line

reviewTitle: Not the value it claims to be
reviewDescription: I bought this product to use with a convertible laptop for ease of typing in tablet mode.It served that purpose well... for two months.I was willing to forgive the lack of color variety and “not-true-mechanical-keyboard” feel. For $20, I felt like I got a bargain. Until the day that I, like at least one other reviewer, had to deeeeeeeeel wth kysssssssss bcommmmmmmmmin randomly “sticky” or simply dysfunctional, like that. Note that nothing seems to be wrong with the keys themselves.I think I’m just going to spend a little more and get a real mechanical keyboard. This one is pretty much only gonna get used again if someone breaks into my house because it’s heavy enough to be a one-use blunt-force instrument of pain... but only because it’s useless as a keyboard now.

Purchased in April 2021 to use for my home office in which I work from home 2 days a week. The letters have worn off on 9 of the keys. Wish it would have lasted longer because I do enjoy the colors of the keyboard and I like how it sounds.

reviewTitle: NO WARRANTY!!! IT"S A LIE! IT BROKE! THEY WON"T FIX OR REPLACE!!!!!!!!!
reviewDescription: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM!!! The keyboard broke within 6 months! I Purchased in October, broke in April and I contacted the seller. I performed all of the tech support they suggested. I have contacted them 7 times. They will not respond. I contacted Amazon and all they did was give me a $5.00 promo credit. This foreign company knows very well what they can get away with. Also after just 6 months

Update_20 March 2023!!! Keys stick or will not type the letter hit.  I had loved this at first but sometimes I need to really hit the key hard to get it to type.  I have owned the keyboard since:This is not one of those heavy keyboards.  It is light.  If you don't plug it in, it will turn off lights to not waste light power while not in use.  Height adjust is perfect. Really love this keyboard.
After charging the keyboard for hours the damn thing still won't turn on. Whenever I plug the keyboard into the USB the red light stays on for about 10 minutes before it goes out

I want to start by saying this item is brand new. Literally hasn’t been used once until today and I could already tell it was defective. I want to also make note that prior to this review the item came just a few days ago so it is quite literally brand new. I booted up the keyboard and attempted to use it and it did just that it worked. However I soon noticed that there was input delay as well as keyboard sticks on quite a few of these keys. This is very upsetting as the keyboard literally hasn’t been used once until now and I only used it for about 5 minutes. It’s very defective for a product that seems to have good reviews with the off chance that my item was the rare case of defects.
PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS KEYBOARD! I bought this keyboard on May 10th, and now it's not working. I have tried to troubleshoot it multiple ways, and still nothing; worst of all, it's too late to return.

No matter what I do, the keyboard doesn't type well, it cuts out constantly missing the letters/keys I type. the battery will be full and acts as if it's dying. It's very frustrating to use. I don't know if I just got a bad one with my luck, but I wouldn't recommend this and would not buy again. I'm pretty disappointed.  Right out of the return window too...

DO NOT BUY!!! I have had this for a couple months now but only used it a handful of times. Now the power switch will not turn the keyboard on.
