I have tried it plugged into the USB and with it on its own batteries wireless. When I slide the switch to on it lights up for half a second then will not stay on. Maybe I got the one bad one they made but this is completely unacceptable.Update: it's been a few weeks and the seller hasn't responded to me yet. I took the keyboard apart checked all the connections, cleaned all the terminals and it still won't work.

I loved this keyboard to start with. I don't use it for gaming, only work, so I am not rough on it at all. It only lasted one month to which I emailed the owner of the shop and asked for a replacement. They said they would send me one & a couple emails later they asked for my address. After that, nothing. I've sent several follow-up emails asking for a tracking number and now all of my emails are bouncing back. If I can't get a functioning replacement I would sincerely hope you could at least give me my money back.

Please don’t buy this keyboard it’s basically a scam! Only had it for literally a month and it just stopped working today out the blue, but the first day I received it I already knew I was going to hate it. It didn’t hold a charge and the backlight wouldn’t stay on, literally had to keep pressing the light botton every 30 seconds to have the backlights on. What a waste of $40

This thing can't be more than a couple months old now, barely ever use it and it doesn't even work anymore.  Plug it in to the USB port, then into the back of the keyboard, only for the backlight to flicker once and then off and doesn't work at all.  Oh well, get what you pay for.  Won't ever buy again.

This is a compact keyboard, yet it has all the bells and whistles. The keys feel closer together than my other keyboards, so it will take some getting used to. The keystrokes are smooth, seamless, and quiet. You can adjust the colors of the backlight, but you won't get an option for a single color. You can also increase or decrease the brightness. It comes with a manual and it has a type C port for charging which is GREAT!Why 1 star? Well while the KEYBOARD is backlit, the KEYS aren't. No light illuminates the letters, so you still need light to see the keys. What I needed is a keyboard with ILLUMINATED KEYS

Input Lag is so heavy and inconsistently inconsistent it’s not viable for anything game related and accidentally tossed the box now I’m stuck with a useless flashlight keyboard. And tested versus a Logitech 2.4 keyboard which worked perfectly fine.

reviewTitle: Crappy characters on the keys, crappy lighting of characters on the keys.
reviewDescription: I liked the mechanical action of the keys. They reminded me of the good old days when  keyboards had actual switches for each key. I realize that experienced typers and gamers don't have a need to look at the keyboard while they are doing what they do. They don't have the  time or the need for that. Consequently, the quality of the characters on the key caps probably isn't as big a deal for them as it is for me. I bought this keyboard for general computer use. I have only begun to learn to type and still need to look at the keyboard as I go. I found that the illumination of the characters on the key caps was quite low and very inconsistent from cap to cap. The image of the keys on the product page is pure fantasy. I found the back light over-powered the illumination of the key characters just like being outside in the sunshine and trying to discern something in the shadows some distance away. Obviously, illuminating the key characters was an after thought, so I do not recommend this keyboard for folks that need to see what they are doing.

reviewTitle: Great until it doesn't charge any longer
reviewDescription: This keyboard is awesome aside from one huge issue. I wanted this keyboard to work so much, I purchased another when the first wouldn't charge any longer thinking I was using the wrong cable or something similar. The first keyboard would sometimes show the red charging light, but most of the time would come on once and go out. The keyboard would turn on for a moment, and then die again. I tried the esc + K stuff the seller mentioned in answered questions, but it does absolutely nothing if the keyboard isn't charged. So I started using the 2nd keyboard, and again it was awesome. Then it died. When I plugged it in with the supplied cable and cell phone charging block as mentioned by the seller, the red light came on steadily indicating it was charging. I let it sit over night and found it with the red light off. Thinking it was charged, I turned it on only to find the exact behavior of the previous keyboard. It would turn on momentarily, and then die again. I tried a different, known working power outlet and plugged it in, again seeing the red light come on. I checked on the keyboard for a few hours all the while the red light was on. After 4 hours I tried again, but the dang thing still won't stay on. Reading through other reviews this seems to be a very common problem. I would not recommend to buy this keyboard unless you're okay with only being able to use it for the duration of the original battery charge.

reviewTitle: Connection to the USB receiver is bad.
reviewDescription: I’ve had it about a week, and it feels decent quality to use for the price, but it’s constantly disconnecting. Mouse becomes unresponsive, then skips around, keyboard turns off and on, on fully charged battery, even plugged into power, it still doesn’t work. I have the mouse & keyboard less than 2 feet away from the usb receiver, and it struggles.  I’m going back to my wired keyboard & mouse, this one just isn’t worth it, others have no problems but definitely be wary and informed when buying this product.

The keyboard or mouse will stop working during the day.  I have tried pulled in, not plugged in on battery.I have to swap the plugs, turn the keyboard and mouse off and back on.Lighting is half assed.Save your money.

I bought this to go along with my brand new computer. I liked the fact that it lit up and figured it would be nice, especially if I work late. After barely 2 months, it had issues. Amazon does not replace or exchange anything after the 2 week period, so you are out of luck if yours dies. My keyboard would stop working even though it was lit. I tried changing ports and using it on different computers. Still didn't work. This cost me several hours on a project that I could not save because my keyboard did not work. Then I wasted another hour and a half dealing with customer service. I will never buy another product from this company again. Buyer beware! One more thing. I did spend a lot of time reading the reviews. They seemed legit but unfortunately, this was defective. More real people should write about it that actually bought it, not the fake reviewers.

It was great while it lasted. Purchased July 12th 2023, and it failed Sept 26th 2023.My work area/ office tends to be dark especially in fall thru spring so I utilize a backlit keyboard so I can see no matter the lighting situation. I work with documents as well as graphics. With both I use keyboard shortcuts a LOT. Losing the backlit feature makes this keyboard useless to me.Contacted seller multiple times in the last several weeks via email and website "contact us" page. Never received an acknowledgement of my contact attempts let alone an actual response.Apparently warranties are useless from this company :(

reviewTitle: Random keys stopped working within a week
reviewDescription: Based on the answers from the manufacturer, I thought the keys wouldn't be so tall on this but they were very tall so if you have easily fatigued fingers, I don't recommend this. But the biggest problem was that several of the keys would randomly stop working for no reason after less than a week of use. On the first day, I had a lot of dropped spaces and I thought it was just me needing to adjust to the rounded bottom row of keys. On the second day, the 0 in the numpad wouldn't work for a few minutes but it started working again so I thought it was a one-off. A few days later, the n key wouldn't work for a few minutes but started working again too. Then yesterday I had trouble with the n, the period, and the comma twice in the same day. Today, I immediately couldn't get the same 3 keys plus the 0 in the numpad to work.  I also realized the space bar issue wasn't my fault either, since it had been sporadic, and now the space isn't working either. I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in and it still didn't work. I managed to get it to work just long enough to get logged into my system for work thankfully, but then I had to copy and paste the characters I needed that stopped working for the next hour. On my break, I chucked it and went back to my old 15 year old dell keyboard and started my return. I was so happy to find a rainbow backlit keyboard with a normal enter key, but I'll put up with the stupid double sized key as long as all the keys actually work!

reviewTitle: no support if the unit goes bad
reviewDescription: It worked for about 7 months than had dead key, no support, not even a reply when asking for it.If you want a product that keeps on working and you want to receive support, don't buy a NPET product.

reviewTitle: Lights up nicely, but NOT quiet
reviewDescription: The way this keyboard lights up is nice, however it is NOT quite at all. I bought it for work hoping it would be quieter than the keyboard I already had, and it would be a little fun with the lights. While the lights are cool, it is rather loud. After the third day using it, the spacebar started squeaking loudly. I ended up bringing it home because it was distracting my coworkers.

reviewTitle: After a month keys wearing off
reviewDescription: Maybe I use the left shift key more than most.  It is wearing off!  Good keyboard but does not hold up to about a month of use

Space bar somehow did an Auto Eject in the middle of typing after 2 weeks. 1 of the 2 springs went flying - never again to be found.This keyboard was only used on a secondary computer typically for only a max of 2 hours per day  - mainly browsing the web (and now, looking for a better keyboard)Keyboard worked fine prior to the space bar coming off.Not happy with durability

reviewTitle: Doesn't light up in all one color
reviewDescription: I was really after a simple backlit keyboard, and should have read the reviews before purchasing.  It can only show 3 tri-color modes, each with 3 light levels.  The 'breathing' pulsating will only stay on  one 'mode'.  The key travel is really too much for my taste - about a 1/4" which is much more than your average keyboard.  It also doesn't turn off after 10 minutes of non-use as advertised.  I am up in the air if I'll keep it now...

I WAS SO THRILLED WHEN MY KEYBOARD ARRIVED.  OPENED THE PACKAGE, LOOKED AT KEYS AND SAID TO HUBBY, "THERE ARE NO LETTERS ON THE KEYS!"  HE LOOKED AND SAID, "YOU'RE RIGHT."  HE GOT A FLASHLIGHT, SHINED IT ON KEYBOARD AND I COULD BARELY SEE THESE ITTY-BITTY-TEENSY-TINY LETTERS.  SO WE CHARGED IT TO SEE IF WITH THE LIGHTS ON, WE COULD THE LETTERS.  NOPE!  THEY ARE SOOO SMALL THE LIGHT GLARE HID THE LETTERS.  I WOULD BET THEY ARE THE SMALLEST LETTERS ON THE PLANET.

I mean... You get what you pay for. I got this keyboard about 4 months ago and already some of the keys are starting to fade, with the black covering disappearing.I should also mention that, twice, I had to unplug it because the keys were not getting recognized.I'm really shocked by all those 4 and 5 star reviews...
Got this in Feb 2022. They KB now has trouble inputting a key stroke if holding shift or if caps lock is on. Pretty frustrating. It's barely 6 months old. Was pretty good up to that point.

reviewTitle: Terrible for use alright for lights
reviewDescription: Well i just recieved my keyboard yesterday and well i thought it was cool and worked great, but no. I was gaming on my pc and wouldnt you know the keys input delay when pressed stays like that, i was playing GTA V and everytime i turn left it would stay that way after i let go od the key to turn around the corner. Extreamly useless only thing that truely works is the rgb workes to ab extent. Also the keyboard turns off every 5 minutes when im using it!

reviewTitle: Good for about 2 months, and that's it.
reviewDescription: Five of the keys on the number pad stopped working: 8, 5, 2, /, and 0.  Also the right arrow key is unresponsive now.  I've had this keyboard for about 2 months now.  It's like it decided to fail about a month after the return policy expired.  Not happy with this.  The keyboard looks ok, but I've seen cheaper keyboards that remain fully functional for years.  You can argue that the numpad and arrow keys aren't that important, but I need those keys from time to time and I can't use them now.  Now I need to find a replacement.  If those keys hadn't failed, I'd be okay with this keyboard.
Noticed sometimes when using a key combination the keyboard will mix the features or won't workNot really worth the cost a normal one would be the same price and function correctly.
Mine was broken right when I got it. When typing certain buttons like backspace I would get a slash instead. Also the writing on the buttons was already coming off. It’s a piece of junk.

reviewTitle: Certain Key Combinations Will Not Work
reviewDescription: I am a programmer and this keyboard has some very strange limitations. Various key combinations/shortcuts don't work. For example I use (left ctrl + left shift + <letter>) for some of my more common shortcuts and certain letters will not work. I received a replacement keyboard that did the same thing and I found reviews from others stating the same thing. Company did not respond when I contacted for support. Returned both. Found some much better alternatives from other companies.

reviewTitle: It was great for a day
reviewDescription: Loved it for the whole day it worked. However it suddenly won't connect to my computer anymore. Tried everything to get it to connect but it just won't.The keys were nice and quiet and the lighting was subtle. If something changes I'll change my review.

reviewTitle: Bought one and failed got replacement and failed exact same way
reviewDescription: If I could, I would rate a negative as the same issue occurred not once but twice.I purchased this keyboard as a value keyboard. Its purpose was not for gaming or anything strenuous. It was supposed to be a simple keyboard for office work. Wanted something that had a mechanical characteristic. One initial usage, it checked all the boxes for an excellent decent mechanical wireless keyboard. But after a bit of use, I started noticing that the battery would last less and less each use. I would charge the keyboard overnight, wishfully thinking I could get a whole day's worth (9-5) of service. However, after a month and a half, the keyboard stopped functioning and stopped charging. As luck will have it, I fell out of the return period, but Amazon was very cool and let me get a replacement for the inconvenience (5 Star Customer Service there). I got the replacement, and sure enough, the keyboard stopped working the same way but now with a shorter life span.Critical Advice goes with a much more trusted brand and pay a little extra. That is what I will be doing. I hope my troubles help you out in your purchasing.
I turn it on, the lights work for half a second, then it turns off and doesn’t respond anymore.

I was dusting my desk, put keyboard in lap, it is heavy and slick on bottom, fell off my lap, three keys broke off permanently.  Buy this if you will never, ever drop it and dont enjoy quality construction.

reviewTitle: Just got it, one of the keys is printed upside down
reviewDescription: Instead of fixing it they used the upside down key. Ruins the look of the keyboard. Considering returning this before I've even tried it.

As a gamer and a student, the shift key is important to me. the left shift key however is super unbalanced, making the left side of the shift key easy to press, but the right side i have to use my full force to push down. after taking off the key to see why it was not balanced, i see that one side of the shift key peg is broken. brand new keyboard and i cant use the left shift key. no other key has this problem. could be a deffective keyboard but as far as im concerned now, this keyboard does not get the job done at all.

reviewTitle: If you're a fast typer, save your money
reviewDescription: Overall, I was happy with the keyboard at first. The keys feel great, its compact and though I could have cared less if it had LEDs or not, it is there for those that like breathing LEDs. But the more I began using it, the more you realize that it just doesn't do a great job at registering pressed keys. As someone with a high WPM, it's just not functional if I have to adjust my typing speed and press a key extra hard to make sure my press is registered. This becomes overwhelmingly frustrating when it comes to typing in a login password and gaming. Even typing this review took longer than necessary because of constantly having to correct myself because this keyboard just cannot keep up. If you're one of those people that type extra slow with 1 finger and push harder than necessary, then this keyboard might be for you.

reviewTitle: You can't see the letters on the keys!
reviewDescription: This just arrived. I plugged it in. Keys feel nice. But the letters on the keys are practically invisible!I turned on the backlight w/ white LEDs and turned them to full brightness. But the letters are still barely visible.This purchase was a mistake. I'm going to give this keyboard to someone and buy a keyboard where the letters are printed w/ white ink.

So, I really liked the feel of this keyboard and I liked the lights as well. But I didn't even have it for 24 hours and it went on the fritz! Once I booted up my PC, the keyboard started rapidly flashing its rainbow colors and the keys stopped working. I unplugged it and moved it to a new USB, but it still kept flashing, so I then rebooted my pc, it continued to rapidly flash and it stopped my tower from booting all the way, once the keyboard was unplugged, my pc continued with its start up. I tried looking up a solution but I didn't find anything and there wasn't any software or a driver for it, there is barely anything about this keyboard online.I did NOT order a replacement keyboard, I'm just going to take my money elsewhere and pay the extra $10 bucks for a keyboard brand I know will work instead of trying to cheap out.My honest opinion? The NPET K10 is definitely not worth $21.99 its more like a $10 dollar  "pray that it works" price range.
THIS PRODUCT HAS TERRIBLE INPUT DELAY AND THIS PRODUCT IS NOT GOOD FOR GAMING! THE MOUSE IS UNCOMFORTABLE AND THE MOUSE TRIGGERS NEED EXCESSIVE PRESS TO WORK! DO NOT BUY!

Worked great the first couple times I used it. Then just stopped working, the lights don't come on the keyboard anymore besides a quick flash when you flip the on switch. Tried un/reinstalling. Nothing. Tried another computer. Nothing. Seems it's the keyboard having issues not the USB plug. Fully charged battery.

reviewTitle: The product is good but it arrived broken.
reviewDescription: The product arrived with the side of the corner of the keyboard broken.

I really wanted to love this keyboard. It was the first keyboard I've owned that the keys didn't wear off over time.Major issue with using this keyboard while gaming. My shift key does not always engage when I hit it. Same with the space bar. Sometimes this causes me to actually die in my game. It's very frustrating to be sitting there button smashing the shift key and about the 4-5th time it finally engages.  I've never had this issue before. Or maybe you want to double tap space bar? Absolutely not. In my game that is Jump+Glide. Well it's real interesting when you don't glide now isn't it? Now you're falling to your death or you just missed what you were trying to get and have to start over.I'm done dying to this keyboard. I'm sure it's great for any everyday average joe that uses their computer to pay bills and scroll facebook... but it's not remotely functional for gaming.

Cheap keyboards have a problem related to what's called "rollover" which means certain key combinations do not register.This keyboard is giving me rollover problems registering the very useful left control+left shift combination. I use this combination all the time in games as well as in my career in IT. For example, ctrl+shift+esc can be used to open the task manager in windows. Ctrl+shift have obvious uses in plenty of games.I consider myself very not-picky about keyboards--I roll my eyes at the other nerds with their $200 mechanical keyboards. But this keyboard... I basically can't use this one for anything I want to use it for. Broken by design. Left control and left shift are probably the most commonly used pair in any 3-key combination I ever use; you can't make a keyboard where that key combo doesn't work!Bootom line: I recommend trying your luck with any other cheap keyboard. At this price range, you might get something just as bad, but it can't be worse.

reviewTitle: Replacement keyboard works!...until it didn't. Avoid.
reviewDescription: UPDATE: Second keyboard also failed. Based on my experience, don't waste your time with this keyboard unless you want it as a decoration. Keys on mine were not consistently responsive. Finish wears off quickly. Frustrating to use. No idea why this gets more than a 1 star rating.My first NPET K11 keyboard had a SHIFT key that was inconsistent in producing a capitalization. Several other keys also seemed to be inconsistent as far as producing accurately as well. I tried to get used to it, figuring I was doing something wrong. That did not seem to be the case. After contacting the seller, a new keyboard was sent and the new one seems to be working properly. My rating is based on the functioning of the replacement keyboard. So far, it seems like what I expected the first one to be as far as features and actual operation. Worth a try if the specs meet your needs.

Wish there were options for more colors and animationUpdate 10-3-23I had the dongle plugged into a USB 3.0 port and had stuttering of the mouse if I plugged in a jump drive into either USB2.0 or 3.0I moved the dongle to a USB 2.0 port and stuttering stopped12-24-23 had to reboot pc today due to connectivityWon't buy this again

When I saw this one I thought it was too good to be true.  Seemed like a nice keyboard for the price.  Sadly, I was right - this thing looks pretty and the keys even feel nice to press, but the one I received was broken.  At least half the keys just wouldn't work, so using it was impossible.I tried everything to make sure it wasn't something on my end.  Restarted the PC, tried different USB ports, and then finally a different PC.  But nope, the issue was definitely with the keyboard.At least Amazon is good about refunds.But yeah, you're better off forking over an extra $30 or $50 and going with a solid brand.

El primero que compré me duró menos de un año, pero aun así, inocentemente decidí darle otra oportunidad comprando otro. Lamentablemente se volvió a repetir la historia 🙂 Así que les recomiendo encarecidamente que se abstengan de comprar estos teclados basura 🤮

reviewTitle: Well built sturdy keyboard, but mouse has some minor flaws.
reviewDescription: The keyboard is well built and has a nice weighty feel to it. The keys are very tactile, have a nice amount of travel, and make just enough sound to give positive audio confirmation when not looking directly at the keyboard.The mouse on the other hand does have a few minor flaws.First let me start off by saying that the mouse is the perfect size and weight. My last wireless mouse was smaller and got lost in my hand, and my hand is medium length.This mouse has a long contoured profile and very responsive left right clicking buttons. The scroll wheel works fine but feels just a tab sluggish when scrolling.My first issue is with the forward and back buttons located on the left side of the mouse. They are so delicately activated that with the absolute slightest of touch, I constantly found myself accidentally backing out of webpages, or forum posts completely losing all that I had typed. It become such an issue that I permanently removed the buttons (see photo).My second issue is with the sides of the mouse being so slick that the mouse was darn near impossible to hold onto if you picked it off the surface for any reason. I constantly found myself picking up the mouse, only for it to drop 2 inches back to the desktop.I actually had to add a small strip of traction tape to either side of the mouse (see photo) to alleviate this nuisance.Other than those couple of minor issues, this setup is very nicely made and easy to use. The mouse issues could very well be personal to me and your experience may differ.

reviewTitle: For a budget price a good keyboard that both a general purpose or office and gamers  should like.
reviewDescription: NPET K10 Backlit Gaming Keyboard, Black, Purchased 10/22, Reviewed 10/22/2022I purchased the K10 budget membrane faux mechanical keyboard. I was searching for a backup budget keyboard because my main PC keyboard gave up the ghost after 7 years. I needed a backup so I could continue working from home, while I waited for the new replacement keyboard to arrive next week.1st impression: when I grabbed the Amazon package at my front door, I thought, "Wow, this is a heavy keyboard." Opening the package, I was impressed with its mechanical keyboard look, and it looked like a quality keyboard but at a budget price of $20. Of course, as soon as I set the K10 on the desk, I started testing the keypress feedback, noise, and how typing felt. Key travel felt a tiny bit stiff but still good for this price point. Any keying noise was surprisingly low.Plugging in the K10's braided USB cable, the first con is revealed: the cable is too short at 67" long, another 6 to 12 inches would be better. The board's RGB lights lit up, and my Windows 10 Pro PC had no issues with the new K10. The next thing I noticed, which is not necessarily a negative, is that the keys are smaller than typical full-sized keyboard keys.  [Update "edit" 4/12/23: I later compared my full size keyboard and the new replacement keyboard I had ordered, and the keypad surface area is the same. (What was different was the K10's top surface has a slightly deeper concave indentation, so the feel is slightly different.)] I am a touch typist capable of 60+wpm so the size of the keypad felt a little off; however, with use, it would feel fine. With nearly 40 years of using and owning many computers and their keyboards, touch typing resulted in some initial missed direct keypad hits, but adjusting was easy. One additional observation: right after startup, a distinct odor was coming from the board, sort of an electrical and plastic overheating smell (note, I had the RGB lights off). After about 20 minutes, it faded, and I haven't noticed it since.  [edit 4/12/23 I have been using nearly 5 months most days on my Hosting Music pc and no issues at all.]What does a touch typist think of the key typing on the K10?• Sore fingers. My fingers were tired after 1 hour, and after 2 hours, they were sore. The problem is how I type, pushing down slightly harder than the average typist, who maybe learned to type on a mushy membrane keyboard. I learned on IBM Selectrics, which required a slightly heavier key press. The keystroke travel is higher or longer on the floating keys of the K10 than on most keyboards at 3.6mm, so I have to push further down for it to bottom out the key travel, and if I am typing hard and fast, my fingers are sore. I tested where the action point in the key travel seemed to be; it's either halfway or slightly higher. So if I type with a lighter keystroke and try to avoid the key bottoming out, there should be less soreness. A lighter touch is possible, and the keys feel good as you type along and shouldn't cause sore fingers. I would like the stroke to be a little softer or less stiff. [edit 4/12/23   After some practice, I haven't had any soreness issues.]• "Noise," a comment about YouTube reviewers Any YT review doing their keyboard review on a wooden desk or a hard desk surface with no large mouse pad that cushions and accommodates both the keyboard and mouse is only testing the keyboard's resonance with the hard desk, and that is likely 2x or 3x louder than typing with a keyboard on a desk size keyboard - mouse pad. Typing noise on the K10 sitting on a 32" x 12" x 2-3mm thick pad was very low.•No movement, the K10 on my full-size keyboard/mouse pad does not slide or move at all. The K10's weight and three rubber grip pads on the front bottom of the chassis, plus the two pull-out feet, securely hold the board with no movement.• Key wobble was not noticeable, very slight on the space bar.• RGB lights, are not my thing, but if there was an RGB selection that lit only the key letters and numbers, that would be ideal. However, it's not an option.I have about 27 days to decide if I should keep the K10 or return it to Amazon. I'm pretty sure it's a keeper.[Update: 4/12/23, I kept the K10 and use it almost daily. For the price and for my type of usage, I would recommend the K10. Would it be a good gaming keyboard? I do play games, I tried it for one game, and it was fine, I have never owned an expensive gaming board or typed on one, so I cannot compare. ]

reviewTitle: Nice keyboard, HERE'S HOW TO DO THE COLOR CHANGES!
reviewDescription: The keyboard shipping in 2024 has NO "LED" Key as spoken of in other comments!  The manual lists the MODEL NUMBERS and instructions for EACH, so check your model number listed on the underside!How to CHANGE COLORS, stop ROTATION, and change brightness on model K10V3 or K10V4:To change BRIGHTNESS: Fn + ↑  or  Fn + ↓  There are 4 LEVELS from NONE to fully BRIGHTTo change to SOLID COLOR:  Fn + Home  (you'll get solid RED), then repeat that to cycle 8 color options, from 7 solid colors, to the rainbow spread, NONE OF THEM FLASHING!So far, happy with the keyboard, not completely silent, but not bothersome at all. And the keystrokes seem consistently smooth to use with none sticking.  In daylight, I also think the brightness of the solid colors is very good when turned full up.  Would buy again.

reviewTitle: Not Perfect but i like it
reviewDescription: I like how it feels while clicking, its quick to respond to my inputs. Although i like the colors they may b a little to bright and i tend to turn them off to use it since having them in the corner of my eyes is a little annoying and they always come back on when you turn it on and off again so you will have to keep doing it.

I receive the product, it's really good. Clicks are silent. Typing in this thing is really comfortable. I got the wired version of this keyboard and it perfroms well. Lots of LED colors you can set on the keyboard. Just one problem is that some buttons are hard to click but if you don't have no problem with that then It's a must-buy for a cheap keyboard.
This model didn't come with the switch to adjust the lights.  Other than that, it seems to be a decent keyboard.
Nice keyboard if you are on a budget. Definitely nicer ones such as steelseries and high ground

I thought this was a pretty cool keyboard with illumination from underneath. And I thought that that illumination would make the markings on the keys stand out pretty well. But in actuality, it is harder to read than a regular keyboard with black faces and white letters. I’m keeping it anyway because it seems to work very nicely with the robust tall keys.

It feels durable but also kind of cheap but it works well and can use in the dark no issue. Soft press are decent, dongle works well. Charging cable is nice lengthDownside is top media button do not light up and led color Pattern resets when shut off/on

reviewTitle: NPET K10 Keyboard is Almost perfect for me
reviewDescription: I like to wait a while before writing a review. I purchased the NPET Oct 2020, and have not had any issues with the performance at all.  I like the three different lighting choices. The board turns off when the PC sleeps, but if there is a program still running on the PC the keyyboard will continue to stay lit. The keys are very nice, noisy and very well spaced for what the work is needed for.  Luckily, I know where to place my fingers on a QWERTY keyboard as the ink on the letters began rubbing off less than a year. I attempted to look for replacements and the replacements were just a few dollars less than the device itself.  Unfortunately, I am the only person able to use the keyboard if I have guests who do not know letter keyboarding well.
I like the keyboard works great the only complaint I don't like the metal bottom to easy to scratch something but generally happy with it I got great deal.
good cheaper keyboard. I wouldnt recommend for gaming per say, simply too lightweight and not enough options.

reviewTitle: I've only had it for a week, but I already love it
reviewDescription: I'd first like to state that I have never owned or used a true mechanical keyboard, so I am not the best judge on that aspect of this keyboard. I do however enjoy how tactile it does feel... typing feels quite nice with this keyboard, and it has a nice sound too. The space bar is the loudest key on it, but I don't mind. The light modes was a little weird to figure out at first. So to cycle through the different colors, just press the LED button. You can also make it fade in and out by pressing FN and LED. You can change the brightness with FN and Pg up/Pg down. One downside to the keyboard is it doesn't have a wrist rest, so if you don't have one already, it might get uncomfortable. I also noticed, if you take off some of the keys, you can see some overspray from the painting (though it only really affects the keyboard cosmetically). Overall, I'd say that this is a pretty good gaming keyboard for the price.

The battery isn't the best and it has flex, but it works pretty well even when gaming. You can use the keyboard while it's charging. The flex isn't horrible, but it is noticeable. The keys are a bit taller than I anticipated, would prefer them a bit more shallow.
The lights work well and it goes into rest mode in a few minutes so you don't waste power

reviewTitle: I can't seem to type on this keyboard
reviewDescription: I bought this for gaming and it seems to be good for that, but I find that I have difficulty with ordinary typing.  I am used to a $12 Logitech keyboard that has a very low profile, and these keys are higher, which causes me to make way too many mistakes, and the keys take more effort to press.  Typing feels like work.

OK so I got a deal on this thing on sale for $20 had some rewards points on my credit card so it brought the total down to $14 or so. I must say my expectations weren't really all that high I mean we are talking about a $20 RGB wireless gaming keyboard how good could it possibly be? Well I'm happy to report that this is actaully a pretty good deal if you're looking for a cheap but effective option for a wireless keyboard. It's pretty nice to sit on my couch and play WoW on my 65" 4k television and not miss a beat. The overall feel of this product feels good. It has some weight to it and it doesn't really give off the feeling that it was made cheaply. Only time will tell how well this product holds up in the long run but I would recommend this product if you're looking to get a wireless keyboard with a lower budget.

This keyboard is a lot quieter than my old one, however the space bar seems to be about the same loudness as my old one. I type super fast and am on my computer while people are sleeping, so I was hoping this one would be extremely quiet so as to not wake anyone while I am typing. The space bar is the only complaint I have about it to be honest. I love the colors, as shown in the pictures, and there is an option to turn the colors off when I head to bed.
Use for work

Usage: 1 Year Office SettingPrice: 5/5Battery: Last for days on end on a single charge. I would use the keyboard 8 hours a day. 5/5Keys: Love the sound of the keys BUT in an office setting, they can be quite loud. I have also used this every week since I have gotten this. The keys that I use often are now worn off. 4/5Look/Feel: Has a good weight. The keys through feel a bit cheap. Overall decent looking keyboard. Love that it is wireless that is rechargeable. I don't have to waste money buying batteries. 3.5/5

If you don't mind the 6 to 8 hour run time before needing to be recharged it is worth the price. I think if the unit came with 2 pop out batteries so one could be charging while the other is in use it would be perfect :)

I game a lot, had alot of different boards. But this one feels great, the lightning it well done. Fn + Home or End changes the effect. Fn + arrow up or down changes brightness. Most keys have a great feel to them beside the spacebar. But only notice if you nit pick. It has a metal backing as well, which is great for longevity.
Obviously there are some down sides. The rgb is slightly darker in some places and it doesn't come with instructions to control the rgb but it's awesome for the price. Definitely worth it.
Advertised as very quiet, but quite the opposite
I’m not a gamer, but I like this style of keyboard for work. It took me a minute to figure out how to change the backlight from constantly changing color to solid color, but once I did it was great.
16 bucks black friday is a deal

I only gave it 4 stars only because the RGB keeps shutting off after a couple of minutes. If this were a wireless keyboard that would be fine but for a wired keyboard that shouldn't even be an option and for me it's not acceptable. That being said everything else is perfect.  Edit- I've tried every button combo I can think of to get the RGB to just stay on and I figure it out, and the instructions don't say anything about it.
Feels great, looks great, works perfectly.  Only down side, it is a little noisier then my last key board.  Definitely worth the money

I got one of these for my Macbook and one for my PC. Happy with them. They are fairly quiet, but not silent, WAY quieter than my Blue key tenkeyless that I can't get used to. Key travel is comfortable for me; I know when I've pressed one! Also I seem to miss the Shift key on my tenkeyless, that doesn't happen on this one. The lighting is easy to adjust, no big deal, I'm not really into the light thing, but it has it, whatever. You can turn them off entirely very easily with the light level control. My only complaint is that the characters on the keys themselves are kind of small, I strain to see whether I'm getting a $ or a % or any of those; I don't have them memorized. Even the numbers are a bit hard to see, I'm terrible with those. I'm good with them though, I'm keeping them.

reviewTitle: Seems like a good product  once you get used to a new keyboard
reviewDescription: So far, the keyboard works pretty well.  I was thinking it would have clicking keys, but it is really very quiet/  The touch feeling is firm and after a while you get positive confidence about pressing a key.  The main complaint that I have is the "go back" key on the mouse.  I accidentally hit it with my thumb often.  So much so that I am considering putting a dab of silicone on the crack surrounding the key to keep it from depressing..
I was concerned about the raised keys but after trying it I like it.  Plus got it the next day

When you take a keycap out the paint comes off. I like the mouse, it is comfortable and it also looks nice. The colors on the keyboard look good just because the colors stay and does not breathe like the mouse.
The led is not bright enough. Just wish it was more brighter  and had more breathing  modes. But i like the keyboard overall
Great money spent, space bar was noises but worth it.
I rated this keyboard with only 4 stars for the cord is a little on the short side when connected to a full tower case beside the desk.  Otherwise I would have rated it with 5 stars.

I notice this keyboard tends to include key presses that I don't make.. It's fine for a cheap backup keyboard though. I think I'm hitting the Ctrl key too often my mistake since no palm rest, but it's a $20 keyboard so I don't expect much...

The 4 stars is because the keys are already fading. Always wanted a backlit keyboard with fun colors but had been putting it off for a while because most are fairly pricey for general or work use. Considering the price I paid I am very happy with this set. Be warned if you have to moisturize your hands a fair amount (skin condition, wintertime, or any other reason) the keys are going to wear away at a much more rapid pace. The keyboard meant for my laptop is much older and doesnt have this issue, but again I went for this because of the pretty colors and price point. (My  personal favorite preset color is the third option when hitting the LED button which is a lovely blue-purple-green/yellow combination).

reviewTitle: Very good, Except for the LEDs
reviewDescription: Very good quality keyboard. Very durable, and sturdy feeling material. The key press feels nice, and the actual keys them self, feel very good. The USB wire is braided, which is always nice. The only reason I am rating four stars though is because of the price, if it was anymore, I would rate three; and this is because of the LEDs.The LEDs give little to no customization, you have 3 lighting settings when using the most basic options. So, the brightness key controls the brightness of the LEDs, and the pulse key controls the rate at which the LEDs pulse. You have three preset LEDs to go through, and that's all you have. The only other customization features, are setting brightness, and you have a pulse option. It doesn't have any software to go along with it, and I haven't been able to find any online. I would rate 3.5 stars if I could. This is just what you get for a 20 dollar keyboard.Overall, It's a GREAT, Keyboard, and you should buy you are looking for a cheap keyboard.
I got this since there was a deal the lights could be brighter but it is really quiet if your on a budget or don’t want to spent a lot then I’d recommend this keyboard

Overall this is about as solid of a keyboard as you're going to find in this price range. Keys are a little smaller than I would have liked, but they feel perfectly solid and I'm not worried about them breaking over normal use, though I could see that happening if the keyboard were to fall off it's surface for whatever reason, so be careful of that.Honestly the 'worst' problem is that sometimes the LEDs on the keyboard don't shut off after I power down my PC or put it into sleep mode, but this is easily fixed just by pulling out the USB cord and plugging it back in.
Nice weight and I like the wrist rest, most keyboards do not have them. The LED button is glitchy, but I don't have a back up keyboard so I will keep it as is

Update 7.17.21Customer service contacted me and sent me a replacement keyboard over night and I'm happy to say that rhe first keyboard was a fluke as the second keyboard is flawless and feels like a much higher priced keyboard.Their customer service is phenomenal and easy to deal with. In fact I didn't contact them they contacted me.The keys feel decent for a lower cost game type keyboard BUT the space bar sticks and unless you hit the space bar in the dead center it will not register, you can not hit the side of the space bar and that is a big no no in a gaming key board making it more or less useless.It would be a 3 star keyboard if it wasn't for the space key issue. With the space key issue it's zero star.
Worked great for one day then my cat spilled water on it. I tried all the safe ways to dry the keys but after three hours of hair dryers and paper towels I had to call it DOA and bought a second one!
Does what is supposed to do

It's not a bad keyboard for the money, wireless works good keys feel good, but the drawback for me was it would only stay lit while you were using it, if you stop while you reading something or chatting with someone the keyboards backlight will shut off in 2 minutes if you stop typing, that's just not long enough, I get they done this, to save the charge but it gets a little aggravating and you can't adjust the brightness, medium brightness. Shutting off after 10 minutes would not have made hardly any difference in the charge. other than that it's a keyboard!NOTE: Not a gamer so I don't have an opinion on its use for gaming.

Depended on the reviews to buy this illuminated keyboard, was not disappointed. The key feel is not what you would call "click type," but the keys have a certain resistance and "bounce" that allows me to type considerably faster. Kind of like the old IBM Selectric typewriters. It just feels good to type on if you are a fast touch-typist. The price is very good. I think it would make a good basic gaming keyboard but I really only use it for email, documents and general typing use.The illumination is good enough for me to use the keyboard at night - my only complaint is I wish the keyboard had a lighting function of one single color at a time. The way it's set up is you get a selection of I think three rainbow color patterns, and you can make them pulse slowly if that's what you want. Or have steady and then able to dim up and down. Or turn off LEDs altogether.But overall for the price it's a really good keyboard. Have not had it long enough to see how the printing on the keys lasts under heavy use. Will update later.

reviewTitle: It's a $20 keyboard, set expectations appropriately.
reviewDescription: For a $20 keyboard, it isn't bad. Solid feeling construction. Rubber dome construction, good spring feel to the keys, bottom out isn't a hard slam against the case. The braided USB cord is flexible enough to be routed around easily, hard-wired to the keyboard so you won't lose it, standard connector and no drivers needed. Thin profile with some rubber feet that try to keep the keyboard from shifting, depends on what surface you place it on. The LEDs are a nice touch, but definitely not fully utilized. There are 3 built-in color schemes , several brightness levels and a "breathing" mode that fades in and out. It's too bad there isn't more to it than that, or at least the option for a solid color across the keyboard.Note, the LED control key takes the place of scroll-lock, scroll-lock has been remapped to FN+F11.It's a good cheap keyboard if you're looking for something you don't mind getting banged around. Can't comment on how long it will last as I've only had a it a week so far. I can recommend this if you're looking for an in-expensive, no-frills keyboard, well minor frills.

I've been wanting a lighted keyboard for a while now. So far I like this keyboard a lot! The keys are bright enough so that I can tell which key is which in the evening when the sun goes down. This keyboard is a bit smaller than my old one, so I'm still getting used to it. I like the fact that's it's a little smaller though. I'd definitely recommend!

reviewTitle: Works Great Until Battery Gets Low
reviewDescription: This is a good keyboard for the money and made well. My only issue is that the keyboard doesn’t have a battery indicator to notify you when the battery is low and if you don’t regularly charge it when you will tap the keys you’ll be entering completely different letters and symbols at random it seems like. When it first happened I thought the keyboard came broken but I decided to try to charge it. After I took it off the charger it was working flawlessly again.So DO NOT let the keyboard battery run low or you will even unknowingly (when entering passwords) be entering the wrong characters and wondering why it’s not working.
works preety good but keys some times stick when held to long ?other wise it works great. thanks

reviewTitle: Colors available on the keyboard's backlights.
reviewDescription: The keyboard itself is great. It is sturdy, durable with backlit keys. The serious downside is that the colors used are shades that are dull. Because of the shades used, they might as well NOT be backlit. They need to be a brighter shadeof colors. The shades of blue, purple, red, and yellowish green DO NOT provide visibility in subdued light unless you are hunkered over the keyboard and look straight down at the board. Even at the brightest intensity setting of the lights do not provide enough light to see the keys in a dim or dark room if your head or eyes are at any type of angle in relationship to the keyboard. That's a shame, because I love every other aspect of the keyboard. It's even resistant to liquid spills. If you don't care about using this keyboard in dim light, this a great keyboard. I have the wired connection model.

I used this for multiple years before switching to razer, but this is a decent membrane keyboard that emulate the feel of mechanical. Just be careful because the wire will get loose if you too rough with it.

I've always wanted a keyboard that I could read at night, as I'm a pretty fast home row typist but often need other random keys for games. I wouldn't call this a pro gaming keyboard, but for the price it's very good quality. It's got some heft to it and feels solidly built. I've had this keyboard for about half a year and have had no issues with it. I am starting to see a tiny amount of wear on my D and F keys which makes some light peak through around the edges of the top surface of the keys. I suspect that within a couple years I'll see quite a bit more but honestly it's not enough to bother me yet.When I received the keyboard, one of the rubber pads at the bottom was missing and was nowhere to be found. I communicated with the company through the amazon message system and they promptly sent me a couple replacement pads. I guess quality control left a little something to be desired, but customer service was great. Just be prepared to wait a little while as I'm pretty sure it came from China. (Probably took a week or so, so not too bad).Concerning the feel of the keyboard, I personally think it's great. It's sort of an in between a mechanical keyboard and a membrane keyboard. Hard core gamers might just snub their noses at this keyboard but honestly it's been my favorite feeling keyboard (compared to the keyboards that usually come included with a mass produced computer). I remember reading some reviews that complained about the comfort of the keyboard but it's been great for my average sized man hands. The keys do tend to feel taller than an average keyboard so if they feel too tall, I would recommend one of those gel keyboard pad dealies to raise your hands up a bit.Anywho, overall I'm very satisfied with the product and customer service over at NPET. It's always a little nerve racking picking a product out of the usual 4-5 copycat products out there, but this one was good.

Decided to give this a shot when my last Logitech board died. I can't stand a low profile keyboard, and many wireless come that way these days. The keys here are full sized and have a satisfying click on press.Battery life has been good. I have been using this to work from home 8 hours a day, 5 days a week. After about a month of use, I can repoet I get about 2 weeks of battery off a full charge. I recommend charging from the outlet (just hooked mine up to my phone charger) rather than charging from USB connection from your computer. I tried it that way first, and seemed like battery didn't charge as full or quickly.****EDIT: After a few months of use, the battery life has gone down to about 1 week. Still works for what I need, and I can plug it in to one my many long USB C cables I have to use it as wired until I have a chance to charge, but might not be ideal for some. ****Lights are nice. Has a few different gradient options, but no solids. I like that there is also the options to dim. My only real compliant, if you can call it that. Is that you need to reset the color and brightness after it dies.
Super light. Comfortable. Only would change 2 things. Wish it angled up a bit more. Space bar makes a squeaky noise.

reviewTitle: Good quality for a low price
reviewDescription: I just needed a keyboard and mouse kit, for my laptop. The keyboard lights up and turns off the Led when not in use. The keys are soft and responsive along with the mouse. One small thing i don't mind it but I'm sure others will, but if you  are sitting back it almost looks like the certain keys aren't lit up.

I have only had the keyboard for a short time so I can only review based on how long I have had it. The keyboard is great for the price and I love the backlight colors. Some of the keycaps were already slightly faded when I ordered it so there is a chance they will need replacing later.

reviewTitle: Keys well and lights are bright.
reviewDescription: Keys are easy to press making typing effortless. Being wireless it is very portable and easy to use where needed. Lights definitely help with seeing the keys while playing games in the dark.

Keyboard:Colors look sharp and bright. Unfortunately there is no breathing mode, though there is supposed to be. Holding 'fn' and pressing 'led'just cycles through the static colors, same as if I was just pressing 'led'. The 'fn' key does work, as I'm able to adjust the brightness.Keys feel nice and it's nice they are removable.It's fairly heavy, but I don't see that as a negative.Mouse:Works well and the rgb looks great. Nice looking color schemes and good brightness.No connection issues so far. The breathing mode not functioning on the keyboard is pretty lame, but it seems like a nice set otherwise, hence rating it 4 stars. Would have rated it 5 stars if the breathing mode worked, and had thought about giving it 3 stars....

I do not use this device to game with. I use this keyboard to type messages on Xbox. The battery life is great. Lasts days without charge. It's a usb-c device and charge times don't take long. The USB dongle that connects to whatever device is a tiny one which is nice. I included 2 pictures of this little USB dongle it's small. Another nice feature is when the battery life completely drains you can plug it into a charger and still use the keyboard while it is charging. I've had this keyboard for a while and it's been doing a good job.

I bought this keyboard because it was advertised as quiet. NOT SO, my dell laptop is a lot quieter. I don't like to hear keys being pressed, this thing is noisy when keys are pressed. Very disappointed in this product.
The keys stopped working after only a couple months and a handful of uses.
This thing died on me after 3 months of light useage. Wont buy again.
Mouse sucks and keeps lagging. Definitely not for gaming
it  works not at all
These keyboards are garbage.  Battery capacity is not adequate, only lasting 90 minutes.  Won't charge well while being used and frequently looses connection with the dongle.

This keyboard works when it wants to. I’ll be gaming and then suddenly the lights will cut off or it’ll stop working. I thought it might be dead but I’ve left it plugged in overnight before and it still has these problems. It’s very glitchy and finicky.

I've owned this keyboard for 2 months, and it never worked properly out of the box. It'll randomly stop responding, no matter how much charge it has, almost as if it freezes for a few moments before working again. I attempted to contact the seller about replacing the keyboard because it comes with a 24 month warranty. All the did was tell me to troubleshoot it and copy/pasted the exact same troubleshooting steps that are included in the manual. I told them that 've already done all that and the item is defective, it is still under warranty, and needs to be replaced. That was 2 weeks ago, they still won't respond to me.

The keyboard didnt keep a charge, it has to remain connected to a power outlet to work which makes it not wireless at all, and it keeps showing me a "usb port power surge error" anytime i connect this to my pc, this is the worst purchase i have made.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for...I should have known better than to buy this.
reviewDescription: I rarely write really bad reviews but this particular product and seller irks me the wrong way. Let me get this eye brow raising bit out of the way first: Under Amazon's My Account/Your Orders, this particular product out of hundreds of other products I have purchased is missing " Leave Seller Feedback" and " Write a Product Review"...among others. I WONDER WHY?Let's talk about the actual keyboard that I purchased for ~$17.00 on August 25, 2018. The date today is October 13, 2018 and already the ENTER Key and the Left SHIFT Key have failed. Meaning, pressing those keys will NOT preform a desired action, ever. It was a gradual but quick failure ( 2 days). Ohh, It's a pretty looking Keyboard but underneath the skin it's full of nasty surprises.The last time I checked, the entire premise of buying a KEYboard is when you press a KEY, it will preform a action. That is its primary function. Really, other than slight ergonomics and how they (KEYS) 'feel', NOTHING else really matters!In the matter of less than Two Months, 2 of the most essential keys required have already failed!I am not the first or last person to complain about this. Do not buy this product and stay away from this seller. Just my opinion.

Have only had it a few months and I use it a few hours a day on average and the coating on the keys is wearing off.  The price was great, and not too bad of a feel using it but I can't stand this, and it's getting worse all the timeI have never had a keyboard do this and usually have Logitech products and I think I will have to go back to them

Yeah, they're cheap, but it's not worth it. I've haven't had this keyboard for very long and already the paint on it is chipping away very readily! I actually had an NPET keyboard before that had this problem too but it didn't happen as fast and that keyboard was like $13 so I thought maybe this one would be better since it costs more - but I was wrong!I think the connection isn't 100% reliable either. I feel like occasionally I have button presses that aren't registered. But I'm not sure this is the keyboard's fault necessarily or if something's going on with the signal interference or my mobo being weird.I'm also not sure I'm a fan of the rechargeable battery. I wanted a wireless keyboard so I wouldn't have to worry about plugging it in, but with this you will have to plug it in every so often when it needs a recharge.

I am glad I bought this at 50% off because it's not worth the full price. It's a decent keyboard but I can't imagine why the key images aren't better lit and more clearly defined. I will not be buying this brand in the future. I use this for a lot more than gaming and there are more suitable keyboards out there.

Pretty cool keyboard (Ver3). LED are nice. I have a MAC and it doesn't work when I turn on the computer. I have to unplug it and plug back in for it to function when the computer fully turns on. PITA but thankfully I don't turn off my computer often (sleep mode). Nice "clack" to the keys.

reviewTitle: Black paint wearing away, so-so LED distribution
reviewDescription: Durability: The metal base does feel solid, and the keyboard has a nice heft. As seen in the photo, the black paint on my D and C keys is already starting to chip (the keys appear to be clear plastic with black paint, not solid black plastic).Noise: This is advertised as "quiet", but it's pretty loud. Isn't that part of the appeal of mechanical keyboards? I kind of like it, but if you're looking for a quiet keyboard, this isn't it. Also, my Shift keys were pretty "squeaky" the first few weeks I had this, but it eventually faded away.Lights: As others have stated, you can't pick a uniform color across the whole keyboard. It's just three sets of three-color combos. That's fine, but don't expect to be able to set it to all-white or all-blue, etc. Also, the lights aren't distributed all that well, so I have bright spots under my D, L, 5 keys, etc, and dim spots on the far corners. The lights also flicker very slightly.Not bad for $20, but has some issues.

Like some other viewers stated, the letters have rubbed off. This keyboard will be one year old in 2 days. The letters started coming off a few months ago. Now they just stop working for no reason, and then work again. I am about to order a new one, but not this brand!! The lights are great and have never dimmed or turned off. But that's just a cosmetic thing....I need the keyboard to work!!! Disappointed.

reviewTitle: Not as good as you think.
reviewDescription: This is my first 'gaming keyboard' as well as one with RGB lighting. I don't care for the lighting.I don't like loud clicks or flat keys. It arrived today and the keys being higher with gaps below them is weird for me.The base is metal and more sturdy than the previous plastic mess I had. I do like this one a lot better.There are two tabs for raising the back slightly. I love having the option to turn off the lighting.Update as of Sept. 2, 2020The black paint on the keys has been coming off for a couple of months. I'm not sure if the company offers replacement keys or what. They seem to be clear plastic and are painted towards the end at some point.8-14-2021 I've had this over a year. I contacted the seller about replacement keys. Provided proof of purchased as asked and NOTHING. I don't remember when I contact and it might have been last year.They keys will rub off and in much less than a year.Can't find replacement keys.

reviewTitle: Not Responsive, Lights Don't Stay On, Turns Off Randomly
reviewDescription: This keyboard doesn't keep up with the speed that I type. It constantly misses letters and I have to type slowly and deliberately, even when the USB receiver is right next to the keyboard and the keyboard is plugged in.The lights go out after 30 or so seconds of idle time, which I didn't know when I bought the keyboard. It's to save battery, but it pretty much defeats the purpose of a lit keyboard.Occasionally when holding down a key (like when moving playing a game), the lights will go off and the keyboard will stop responding until the key is let up and re-pressed.It has good reviews, so I'm guessing this one is just defective. I foolishly threw away the package, otherwise it would be returned. Ordered a different one and this one will get tossed in the closet as an emergency backup.

reviewTitle: Had a lot fun with it
reviewDescription: The main reason we use wired keyboard is for its signal stability and sensitivity.This keyboard however determines on its own pace what needs to be done.(1) Sticky key - all of sudden one ramdom key would repeat itself for one or two seconds - damn did I spill coffee on my desk? No! Did I touch it accidentally? No... I feel like this keyboard has a soul.(2) It stops reacting just like - wait a second, let me think, what did you just type, sorry I missed it.These over-reacting or non-reacting happens about 3 to 5 times a day to me, and I missed the return window...Seriously, if you want to have some fun with your keyboard, no brain go with this one!

Have had this keyboard for less than 6 months now. It has started to make an AWFUL noise. I will need to get a new keyboard already. It's a HIGH pitch squeaking that I've tried to solve but no luck. I work from home and use this everyday so I can't continue to use a keyboard that makes my ears bleed. If you are planning on using this for your WFH job please look elsewhere

reviewTitle: Had to return it for replacement
reviewDescription: The Shift-T on the left side of keyboard does not work. The right side and the cap locks work just fine. All other keys work and they keyboard is greatexcept for that...

The first keyboard I got, the space bar was loud so I replace it.  The second one was better and relatively quiet, although the escape key was very loud.I got this keyboard so I could see the keys better in the dark.  I type mostly w/o looking down at the keys, but sometimes I need to hit the f5 or f10 keys, and I can't see them if the room is not bright enough.The keys are bright enough.  What made me stop using this after a few weeks was the fact that it is slightly smaller than a standard keyboard.  Therefore, my typing suffers because I'm constantly missing the keys.  I don't know if I can return it, but if I can, I will.

reviewTitle: Very high keys; Ctrl functions do not work; N and Y keys stopped working after only a few days
reviewDescription: This keyboard was highly disappointing. You cannot ctrl + c or ctrl + v to easily copy and paste. This is the BIGGEST frustration. You have to right click just to paste things?! The keys are so high that your hands are at an awkward angle to type. You have to press the "function" button to do anything with the F keys, even for something as simple as turning up and down volume.  The N and Y keys stopped working after only an hour or less of use.I had to replace this keyboard rather than simply return it, because I can't afford to go out and buy another keyboard right now, and I need one ASAP. I really hope the new one works longer than two days. I really dislike this keyboard and are assuming the reviews here are fake.

Initial Review: I was initially concerned that the keyboard, being re-chargable, would not be able to be in use while charging, but I'm happy to report that that is not the case! I can leave it connected to my laptop via the charging cable while still using it. It does run out of battery fairly often; I use it for 8-hour work from home shifts and it needs charging every few days. But I love the sound and feel of the keys, and the rainbow effects are really cool. Definitely a great value for the money!9/21/21 Update - The keyboard is starting to malfunction on me. It will leave out letters I have clearly already typed, or get them out of order if I type at my regular speed. Downgrading to 2 stars as I can barely use the keyboard like this.

reviewTitle: The paint is rubbing off on the keys
reviewDescription: The low overall rating because after  only having this for 2 months, the black color on the  keys are already starting to wear off, it is only a  20 dollar keyboard, so you get what you pay for :O

Had this keyboard for a couple of months and it was working fine. Then all of a sudden I will see the source code pop ups on websites, and if I was in an email or a document the save as dialog would pop up. Checked all the keys, nothing seems to be stuck in the down position. Unplug the keyboard and run through all the keys, plug it back in and it is still happening.Plugged in the cheap little keyboard that came with the PC and no problems.I would leave this one unplugged for a few days, and when I tried it again it would work. After a couple of days though it starts happening again. So obviously there is something where it is registering the F12 key as depressed (not a key i ever really use) This essentially renders the keyboard useless.I would have hoped to have gotten more than a couple of months out of the thing.

The keyboard was good until it wasn't. I didn't have it a full week before it stopped working. I thought that charging the keyboard would resolve the issue but it didn't. I also disconnected the USB and reattached it but the keyboard still didn't work.

Keyboard works really well, and the keys have a very solid feel to them. My problem with keyboards is how fast the keys fade. In the production description they state the keys are specially coated for long term protection. Either this keyboard got skipped, or that is completely false. This is the fastest I've ever had a keyboard start flaking or fading. Otherwise a really good keyboard.

Purchased this keyboard in June. It is currently taking up space in our local landfill. The LED functions are nice and the keyboard is old school ergonomic. The quality of the keyboards internals are poor. The keyboard will begin to malfunction and fail to operate properly. I was unable to type or multiples of the same letter would appear when a key was pressed. For $20 you can roll the dice and see if you can get more than 6 months of use, but it is a poorly manufactured keyboard.

reviewTitle: Keyboard was bent when I received it.
reviewDescription: The keyboard was bent when I got it and doesn't sit flat on my desk because of it. Other than that it works for now. Also it was jammed in a box that was to small for the product... Thats probably why it was bent in the first place.
Really unfortunate. Just very rough mouse controls and both keyboard and mouse get unresponsive.

The most annoying feature is the battery life protection. If you press a key for longer than about three seconds it resets and you must let go and press it again. Imagine playing fallout and having to repress W every three seconds!Second the range is very weak at about 10 feet. I had it plugged in the rear of the computer but it wouldn’t work at all. It needs direct line of sight and even then is not reliable at even 10 feet.Lastly, the battery life. I purchased to be cord free. Of casual gaming and web surfing the battery lasts about two days before needing to be plugged in again.Overall, I would not recommend and I returned to my original work around of USB cable extensions. I tried to give it a chance and all it did for me was move beyond Amazons return window.
I didn't like the item it was missing a part so it doesn't work

Occasionally this keyboard just freaks out and you have to HAMMER the keys for the keystroke to be recognized. I leave it plugged in all the time. I unplug, cycle the power multiple times often getting no better results. Then it can start working normal again.When it is working properly... it seems just fine for gaming or other. The backlighting is pretty but the dark keys can be too dark.I have decided I HAVE to get a different keyboard... as when this one goes on the fritz... my anxiety goes thru the roof. Be warned. Good value WHEN it works as advertised. Too often, sadly, that is not the case.

reviewTitle: Would not buy this brand again due to poor quality
reviewDescription: I like this keyboard WHEN it works the way it should. Several of the keys get stuck in the down position and won't pop back up until I shove a pen or something under the keys to push them back up. This happened after 2 minutes of using it. I have now used it more than a day or two and the SAME exact thing is happening. For paying $30 for this keyboard it should not do this after just this short use of time. If you have had it for years and used it on a continuous basis, i could see the keys sticking but NOT BRAND NEW OUT OF THE BOX! UGH  Here is YET ANOTHER item from Amazon i have purchased that is just a waste of money and it's frustrating! If i could give a half star that's what this would get!

reviewTitle: Background too light, can't see the keys.
reviewDescription: Background too light, can't see the keys.

I don't think I've ever written a review before. But, because of the terrible experience I have had with this product, I feel like I need to. First off, after two days, the left shift key stopped working. I also thought that I was having problems with my operating system I could only type in all caps symbols when I was using the number keys. After restoring my computer from a backup, I tried again and it worked great for about 10 minutes. That's when I tried rebooting my computer and using my old keyboard and everything worked great. I'm returning this cheap piece of junk and getting my money back. Save yourself the time and the headache buy from a different seller.

reviewTitle: Great at first, 4 mos later - keys NOT working properly
reviewDescription: I ordered this keyboard back in October 2020 and I was super excited, the lights in the keyboard were really pretty and I like that you could change them to different modes - This is for at home working and school, not gaming. The keyboard is advertised as quiet, it is not. But I let that go and now unfortunately I am out of my return window b/c several buttons are no longer functioning properly, the space bar does not always work, there are some shift plus letter keys that no longer produce a capitalized letter, it’s really turning out to be the worst keyboard I have ever purchased. Pretty disappointed that this has failed so quickly after purchasing. Buyer beware :(
Everything about it is just terrible don’t buy.. got fooled by the reviews

Absolutely garbage keyboard. Barely works at all. Battery lasts all of 20 minutes and even when you have it plugged in to a charger the keys hardly work. LED lights are also inconsistent with their brightness. Basically, the lights are brightest at the center and get progressively darker the closer to the edges you get. Seriously, do not waste your money on this at all. You'll spend more time with it plugged in than you will with it wireless and even then you won't get any performance at all. DEFINITELY do NOT use this as a gaming keyboard since the keys will stop working right when you need them the most.
This has been a welcome addition to our game room. Lots of color and works great!

reviewTitle: UPDATE: Nice mouse and keyboard but...
reviewDescription: UPDATE: I received great customer service. I was having issues with my keyboard and mouse holding charge and customer service sent me a new one.Nice mice and keyboard. However, they both stopped holding charge after about 2 months of use. I contacted customer support and will update review accordingly...
Over all keyboard and led lights are pretty good. Some of the letters looks like it wasn't cut out completely so it looks like the whole letter is not completely visible. Other thank that not bad.

reviewTitle: Not working right out the box. For the second time...
reviewDescription: Second time I ordered this item.  Both times keyboard dead right out of the box.  Won't take a charge and lights won't turn on.  Big waste of time.  Now I have to fiddle with another return for the second time.  Very disappointing. I strongly encourage you look elsewhere for a keyboard and mouse...UPDATE:  Company reached out to me and made sure I got one that worked.  Thanks 😊I have to say this item feels pretty high quality. And I really like the way the keys feel.  Back lighting is nice and bright. I'm really hope this unit lasts...

reviewTitle: Edit: I like this keyboard but could be better.
reviewDescription: Pros:* Priced well (I paid $29.99. At the time of writing this review it is 25.99)* Feels great to type on.* RGB options are decent but can be turned off as well* USB A to USB C cable included* Rechargeable built in batteryCons:* There's better RGB options out there if RGB is your thing but not at this price range* EDIT: Connecting the keyboard to a computer via the USBC cable doesn't allow you to type. Only chargeI've been using this keyboard for about a month now and I have to say I was very surprised at how much I actually like this. I was looking for a wireless keyboard that didn't include a mouse since I already have so many mouse and I didn't want another one. I came across this keyboard and it appeared to be the best for the price. I really like the way it feels when you type. There's a good amount of feedback but it doesn't have that super "clicky" sound that Cherry MX Blue keyboards do. Though there is a softer tactile sound which I like.In terms of RGB, there's a few presets on the keyboard but there's no software to customize them. You can choose different led presets by pressing the LED button on top of the "Home" button (see pics). Also try pressing "FN" + "LED" buttons and the keyboard will add a  cool breathing theme to the lights. You can turn the brightness of the lights up or down by pressing "FN"+"Pg Up"/"Pg Dn". There's only three levels of brightness though. You have the option to turn off the RGB all together if that isn't your thing by pressing the "LED" button a few times which is what I usually do. If you really like RGB there's other keyboards out there that are better if you are willing to pay more.I also really like the fact that the battery is rechargeable via any USBC cable. They provide a USB A to USBC cable in the box which you can use to connect to a charger. The charge from what I can tell lasts a long time. I've never had to charge it after a month.They missed a great opportunity here where they could have made the keyboard work both wired and wireless but they only made it work wirelessly. I think this was a missed opportunity because it would have been beneficial to gamers who care about response times and also the reason why I'm taking off a star.Also to linux users that are wondering, this did work for me wirelessly on Pop OS without having to do any kind of driver installations so it should work fine for any Ubuntu based distros. I can't confirm for other distros but I would think it should work fine.All in  all this is a very good keyboard. I would recommend it to professionals trying to get their work done. I wouldn't recommend it to gamers who play competitive games.

I love the floating keys and the light show the keyboard supplies.  I don’t use it for gaming so I cannot speak to that aspect.  For quality though, it serves the purpose well. The only significant drawback is that you can’t see the letters light up very well from the backlight unless you’re standing up. I’ve had other keyboards that are far superior in that regard. Overall though, it’s a decent keyboard.
Useful and has a good "key feel".
I like these keyboards, but had some fading on some keys, but no complaints. Would buy from again.

reviewTitle: Nice keyboard for a nice price!
reviewDescription: I like the feel and spacing of this keyboard.  I have larger hands and it feels natural for me.  The keys are responsive.  The backlit sadly only has 3 settings: (green, blue, red), (blue, red, green), or (cyan, magenta, yellow) each in 1/3 of the keyboard.  There is a flashing mode too.
nice item but found others just as good at half the price on temu!

I hope you know your keyboard. I type a lot but I am not a typist. The letters on the most used keys are gone! It took over a year for it to happen and for the price, I really can’t complain. It’s comfortable to use and I use it for work 3 to 5 days a week. It was recommended to me and I have recommended it to others with no complaints so far.

reviewTitle: Get what you pay for-EDIT INCLUDED
reviewDescription: EDIT: I would like to edit and add that the company reached out after my review and sent me a replacement keyboard for free. This keyboard seems to be working properly with no sticky keys. Cannot speak to its lasting ability yet, but so far so good. 2 stars changed to 4. It's still most definitely get what you pay for, but their customer service and quick response definitely deserves an edit!I originally loved this keyboard. My U key starting sticking immediately, but it was off and on and I don't use that key a crazy amount so I didn't worry about it. But now I have only had this since keyboard since September and it's already crapping the bed. Multiple keys are not working and it randomly flashes on and off (fully charged). As long as you're keeping in mind that you're getting a $30 keyboard then you're definitely getting what you pay for.

reviewTitle: Keyboard is nice, need a mouse to pair with the usb dongle
