reviewDescription: The board is beautiful, quite, and functions as expected. However, I would like to purchase a mouse that works on the same usb dongle as this keyboard. Is there any way for that to occur?

reviewTitle: good keyboard to upgrade from a cheaper one
reviewDescription: The keyboard is great, Nice looking and all the keys sound good except the spacebar. It sounds metallic, unlike the rest of the keyboard. The reason for the 4 stars is because of the LED's and the lack of functions. all you get is a breathing affect and you can change the light color but not position. would be nice to have some different functions and affects, Lke having the colors wave over the keyboard from either side or rotate around it.

I totally love this keyboard. It allows me to type with fewer mistakes because the buttons are big enough to only key one at a time. My letters have started to scratch off, other than that it’sa good buy.

Pretty mechanical keyboard and gi es you all that you want from an RBG mechanical keybaord...Can switch out the keys etc and wireless. If it can be used while charging would have made it perfect but that's prettt much the only downfall this keyboard has
I wish the keyboard didn't go to sleep and turn off the backlighting.  Other than that it is exactly what I expected this is my second K10 and I really like them.

I've had this keyboard for a year and it's still functioning perfectly. There is some noticeable wear on the paint in frequently used areas. The keyboard is relatively quiet but also sounds nice.After a lot of use, the paint will wear. I have used this daily - for several hours at a time - for a year. I've attached an image that shows the scratches in the paint. I have never spilled anything on it. You can use that as a measure of the paint's quality.Overall, this keyboard is extremely good for its price. Although the cosmetic aspects of the keyboard aren't the best, its functionality is great. Despite the cheap paint, the keyboard feels high quality when typing on it.
It fits my needs and the space

Just got it today.  The keyboard has a really nice feel. The backlight is nice - just the right brightness, and has an "off" feature. There's a separate key on the board for that. Price is good for what I got.  But.....  there's a problem with the "k" key. Any key I press on the keyboard adds an extra "k", so .com becomes .comk. I've emailed the company. The phone number (in China) they list was busy every time I tried it. I also contacted Amazon and they'll take this one back and issue a refund. I'll order another. I'll update when I have the replacement.Update. I returned the defective keyboard and purchased a new one. The new one arrived quickly and (so far) appears to be working perfectly. The company also contacted me about sending me a replacement. Great customer service! As for the keyboard itself, it has much better tactile feel than what I'm used to. Keys feel solid and the lighting is a nice touch. I'm not a touch typist, so I don't know how well this would hold up under heavy use, but it should work well for me.

First thing to note, this is an "off-brand" device.  Didn't really know what to expect.  You  can tell by  looking at it, thats it an off brand as the lettering  and such is slightly off.  Functionality though is pretty good. Im probably going to have to play  with the sensitivity setting a bit but other than that...a completely functional  keyboard at a great price.

The keyboard is relatively quiet (could be quieter), but the backlighting of the keys really helps make them readable in low light. It has a good feature set. In all, it's a good value for the money. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably sophisticated gaming keyboard that works just fine in a business situation.

reviewTitle: Looks and feels really nice, but not very well lit
reviewDescription: Keyboard works pretty well and feels nice. Only real complaint is the left quarter is not very well lit, starting at about the R/E key and going left.
I returned this, but just because I wanted to go with something simpler. This one does really cool light effects and works well for a budget keyboard.

I was looking for a keyboard that was backlit and had good clear font on the keys. This one checked the boxes and had good reviews. I have had this keyboard for over a year and hit it. It has held up well there hasn’t been any peeling off the keys I like that you were able to change the colors. I change them to match my desk set up overall solid keyboard no problem so far.

Overall I think the keyboard is really nice BUT the packaging it came in would be the worst part. I was expecting it to actually come in a seperate box but instead they just put a label on the keyboard box. I'm not sure what happened but the box was dented on the sides and nothing much happened to it but there wasnt any protection around which worried me most.As for the keyboard, I think the typing sounds nice and its like a regular mechanical keyboard. The key caps are a bit wobbly especially the space bar but it doesn't really affect the typing sound (except for the space bar, you can hear it in the video I included). For gaming, I think its good, theres not much wrong with the keyboard that would make it hard to play with or anything like that but then again, I just started using it today so if anything goes wrong I will. update the reveiw.  For $20 its a pretty good keyboard considering the other keyboards with the same functions as this are around $30-50 average so I think its definitely worth it if you are thinking about buying it. Ive included pictures and a video of the keyboard if you want to look at it.
this keyboard is fairly decent it works for modern gaming and regular coding use. it does have a slight tilt that can mess with carpal tunnel however so make sure you have a pad under it

I originally gave a 2-star rating stating it was slowing down the activation of my mouse and keyboard when i brought my system out of sleep.  The number and caps indicator lights weren't working. Turns out it was my new 4K monitor refresh rate.  For that, I apologize and have modified my rating and comments accordingly.This is a nice inexpensive backlit keyboard. I like the feel and action of the keys, and it takes up a small footprint on my limited desktop.  My only gripe is that the lighting is very dim at the top of the keyboard where the function keys reside. Especially on the left quadrant (ESC F1 through F4).  But for $10 I can live with it.
It’s a great keyboard for the price, no issues.

reviewTitle: Great value but exactly what you pay for
reviewDescription: I really like this keyboard, I really do. It does exactly what i need: responsive buttons, built in short cuts that i did not have in the past and it lights up. All around it does the job i need it for and it does it well. I have it hooked up to a KVM switch so i can seamlessly switch devices. so I use this keyboard on my work laptop, my gaming PC, my personal laptop, and probably my game console if i feel like plugging it in. It works great and I am actually very comfortable with using this keyboard for an assortment of tasks.My gripes are with where the manufacturer cut corners to keep the price where it is. the keys are all transparent keys that are colored to be black, which is fine but tiny dots of the black have faded off and i have had this keyboard for 3 months. the keys at the edge that touches the board when you press down, those are sharp to touch. granted not many people will touch those but i like feeling around and for a person with sensitive or soft skin,they could probably cut them selves.All in all, give this keyboard a chance, but keep certain things in mind. It is at such an affordable cost for a reason
Space bar broke kinda easily but it was also easy to fix and it hasn't gave me anymore problems
Decent keyboard. Works better than a lot of the more expensive brands. Some of the keys are a little hard to read. Figuring out the lighting isn’t the easiest but not impossible.

Keyboard is NOT lightweight. Had a metal frame on the underside. Mouse hibernates after a few minutes of inactivity causing you to click the button to wake it up. Not bad, but I have accidentally clicked on things I didn't mean to just whole waking up my mouse. Great for gaming. NOT great for working from home.

This is an absolutely tremendous keyboard for the price, especially if you need the sensory aspect of typing. Two things: the first time I ordered it, one key was broken, and I had to send it back for a replacement. Not sure if anyone else had this issue, but it may be indicative of broader quality control issues. The second thing is that turning off the keyboard disco required me to look here, in the reviews, as the method for turning off the lights (or changing them) was *NOT* what the instruction manual said. Please see one of the other reviews for instructions--you can change it.

A lot to like about this keyboard. Google key touch and sturdy construction. The lights could be one of them but they power up in a swirling rainbow which is distracting and some colors do not illuminate the keys well. (I  work in a dark environment. ) instructions say this can be controlled with the "[LED]" key but nothing on the keyboard says or suggests "LED" to me. Sent an inquiry to the dealer/manufacturer a week ago but they have not responded.
I wanted a deep key, LED keyboard, and I got one! Charges fast, sounds amazing, and has multi color schemes. If you're a sensory seeking buyer, this is the keyboard for you at an affordable price!
Nice built, strong Keyes very quiet.  Feels rugged and tuff.  Used it for 3 weeks home office, still going strong.

I've not had any major issues with it.I've had the keyboard for 16 months.  I'm an enterprise software developer - so while i use the keyboard every day, i'm not straight up typing all day long.The key caps are cheap and mine have started to deteriorate.  This is not an issue of functionality, though - the black paint is wearing off, exposing the translucent material of the caps such that more light is let through, and you can no longer read the letter.  The space bar now has a huge blob that lets light through.Recently i've seen an issue where Windows seems to think the Windows key is constantly pressed, and i have never encountered this using any other keyboard.  Even with the ability on this keyboard to lock out the Win key, it continues to happen.  I've turned off sticky keys and all of the related nonsense in Windows, but the issue randomly continues to happen.  Unplugging the keyboard and plugging it back in doesn't correct the problem - only a full reset will fix it.  It's certainly possible that this is not the fault of the keyboard, but as i've never once seen this in the past 30 years i've used windows, i thought i should mention it.My only other gripe is that i find the colors a bit annoying.  I wish there was just a regular white backlight option.  For the first few months of use, i just had the lights off.  But the key caps are very shiny, and although i'm certainly able to type without looking at the keyboard for 95% of the time, there are still a few symbols and F keys i need to look at.  The shininess means that there's enough glare to make the keys unreadable.So overall, it's fine.  It's better than the $10 keyboards i've used most of my life.  It's easy to clean, feels fine to type on all day, and hasn't completely disintegrated over the past year.  Given the price, it's hard to argue with it.

reviewTitle: Everything is good except for the down arrow key that broke after a week.
reviewDescription: The NPET K10 Gaming Keyboard is a membrane-style gaming keyboard that has been designed for gamers.In terms of build quality, the keyboard appears to be well-made with a durable plastic construction and a comfortable design. However, the fact that the down arrow key broke just a week after use is a concerning issue and raises questions about the keyboard's overall durability.In terms of performance, the keyboard has a range of gaming-specific features, such as anti-ghosting and media controls, that make it well-suited for gaming. The backlit keys are also a nice touch and allow for comfortable use in low light conditions. However, the broken down arrow key could be an inconvenience for some users and may affect their gaming experience.The keyboard is also relatively affordable, making it a good option for gamers on a budget. However, the fact that a key broke just a week after use suggests that there may be issues with the keyboard's overall durability and quality.Overall, the NPET K10 Gaming Keyboard appears to have some attractive features for gamers, but the broken down arrow key raises concerns about the keyboard's durability. As with any product, it's important to weigh the pros and cons before making a purchase, and to consider the potential risks and drawbacks before buying.
I have yet to use it for gaming but so far so good. Haven't had a mechanical keyboard in some time. Didn't expect it to come with a key cap remover.
